fields.name: Paradise Beach
fields.description: This is the most famous beach on the island for a reason - expect bright white sand and clear blue water with a good selection of facilities, including sun loungers to rent, a small bar, watersports and even a small cluster of water rides comprising of some slides and inflatable rocks - ideal for kids.

fields.name: Tsilivi Beach
fields.description: Tsilivi Beach is a Blue Flag beach with bright white sand and clear blue water. Spend some time sunbathing or have a go at watersports such as windsurfing, water skiing, pedalos, jet skiing and paragliding.

fields.name: Zakynthos Town
fields.description: Zante's main town is the hub of commercial activity on the island. Here you can find markets and shops selling souvenirs, cafes and restaurants which serve a variety of traditional meals and international dishes.

fields.name: Blue Caves
fields.description: These magnificent caves are one of the island's most famous attractions, and see thousands of visitors each year. Discover the caves by boat where you can see stalactites hanging from the ceiling within the rock cavities.

fields.name: Day trip to Kefalonia
fields.description:
Take the ferry to the Island of Kefalonia where you can visit St Georges Castle, the 150-million-year-old Drogarati Cave, Aghia Efimia port and harbour, Myrtos Beach and Argostoli, the island's capital.

Source: http://www.visitgreece.gr/en/ and https://www.jet2.com/

fields.name: Megali Ammos Beach
fields.description: You'll find Tsilivi Beach, with it's bright white sand and clear blue water, just a short stroll from Mykonos Town centre. Spend some time sunbathing on the beach or have a go at watersports such as windsurfing, water skiing, pedalos, jet skiing and paragliding.

fields.name: Mykonos Town
fields.description: Zante's town is a sight to behold, charming visitors with its cobbled passageways, whitewashed buildings and dinky churches. Here you can find boutiques, designer-label shops, souvenir stores, bars, bakeries, cafes and restaurants which serve a variety of traditional meals and international dishes.

fields.name: Cynthus
fields.description: This ancient site is the sanctuary of Athena Cynthia, which forms part of hugely historical Delos. You’ll be able to hike up Mount Cynthus and explore all the museums and marble ruins.

fields.name: Paradise Beach
fields.description:
Get ready to party non-stop at the world-famous Paradise Beach. Enjoy cocktails and great music on the shore by day. And as the sun sets, make the most of international DJs and artists playing at the surrounding beach clubs.

Source: https://www.jet2.com/

fields.name: Mikros Gialos Beach
fields.description: Mikros Gialos Beach is a Blue Flag beach with a golden sand shore and turquoise waters. It’s tucked between rolling hills, so might take some finding. Once here, spend some time sunbathing and taking in the stunning views across the bay.

fields.name: Lefkada Town
fields.description: Lefkada Town is the commercial centre of the island where you can find shops selling clothes, accessories, books, homeware, handmade trinkets, deli goods. The town's waterfront has bars, cafes and restaurants which serve a variety of traditional meals and international dishes.

fields.name: Papanikolis Cave
fields.description: Papanikolis Cave is located on the quaint island of Meganisi and is the second largest sea cave in Greece. To reach it, hop on a cruise from Nidri Harbour.

fields.name: Day Trip to Meganissi Island
fields.description:
Take a ferry to Meganisi Island and spend the day experiencing the unspoiled beauty. You'll find picturesque villages, deserted beaches and fish taverns where you can taste the local delicacies.

Source: http://www.jet2.com and https://www.greeka.com/

fields.name: Playa Dorada
fields.description: Playa Dorada – which locally means 'golden beach' – is nothing short of pristine.  No wonder it's so popular with both locals and visitors. Spend some time sunbathing on the beach or enjoy a swim in the clear turquoise sea. There are plenty of shops and cafés in the surrounding area in case you need to refuel.

fields.name: Marinaside Shopping
fields.description: For some upmarket shopping, visit Marina Rubicon where you'll find boutique clothing and tasteful souvenirs. Browse designer fashions at Lacoste Ferrer, or get some new swimwear from Lady Russ. Arte de Lava has some interesting paintings and prints, while Think Natural is the place to go for jewellery and aloe vera gifts.

fields.name: Timanfaya National Park
fields.description: Timanfaya National Park has a Mars-like landscape which was created by over 100 volcanoes. Grab a bite in El Diablo restaurant for a dining experience with a difference. Food is cooked using geothermal heat - the temperature below ground sizzles at 600 degrees centigrade.

fields.name: Marina Rubicon Eateries
fields.description:
Enjoy a bite to eat at the Marina Rubicon's restaurants while watching the sun set over the water. Unsurprisingly, delicious fresh fish is the main staple, but you'll also find plenty of options for tapas, pizza and pasta. For a light snack and a drink, the charming Cafe del Moar is our top pick.

Source: https://www.jet2.com

fields.name: Playa del Duque
fields.description: This tranquil beach in Costa Adeje is perfect for relaxing and sunbathing. Hire one of the many sunloungers and enjoy the soft breeze drifting in from the sea. And if you're hungry there's a beach bar close by. Or you can amble along the promenade, where you can find plenty of bars, restaurants and boutiques.

fields.name: Fanabe Market
fields.description: The twice-weekly market (Saturdays and Thursdays) is located near the beautiful Fanabe Beach on Costa Adeje. Here you can buy a variety of goods including locally-made crafts and excellent cheeses. It's customary to haggle over prices at these markets, so be prepared to find a bargain.

fields.name: Costa Adeje Golf Course
fields.description: A Championship course, the pristine greens and fairways are surrounded by volcanos to one side and the sea on the other. If you don't have time to play the full 18 holes, why not try the driving range, one of the chipping greens, or simply enjoy a cocktail on the Clubhouse terrace.

fields.name: Teno Activo
fields.description: From scuba diving with turtles in the clear sea to star gazing on a volcano, there is so much to do with Teno Activio. The friendly and experienced staff will lead you on unforgettable adventures around the island.

fields.name: Puerto Cabopino Beach
fields.description: Natural dunes and clear waters, all set against a backdrop of lush hills and woodland, make Puerto Cabopino one of the most beautiful beaches in Marbella. After a morning of sunbathing, it's just a short stroll to the marina's restaurants and bars where you can lunch on seafood while watching the yachts come and go.

fields.name: Marbella Town
fields.description: Hunting for the perfect souvenir to remind you of your trip? Look no further than Marbella Town. The cobbled streets are lined with independent shops selling authentic Spanish goods from jewellery and bags to olive oil and soap. Make sure you head to the boutiques off Orange Square for labels you won't find anywhere else.

fields.name: Avenida del Mar
fields.description: Get some culture on your way to the beach with a stroll down Avenida del Mar. The street has been transformed into an open air sculpture garden featuring works by Spanish artists Salvador Dali and Eduardo Soriano among the flora and fauna. There are plenty of cafés and bars nearby so pull up a seat and enjoy the view.

fields.name: Los Moriscos Golf Club
fields.description: A modern course of exotic fruit and palm trees, lakes and manicured holes, Los Moriscos Golf Club is the place to go in Motril if you’re seeking a bit of time perfecting your swing. There’s a driving range, a full 18 hole course and even a Clubhouse terrace where you can enjoy a cocktail.

fields.name: Stalos Beach
fields.description: Beige, burnt-biscuit-coloured sands form Stalos Beach. The glittering cobalt waters are particularly alluring for a swim, but there should be ample towel space if you’d rather just be lazing around. Beach volleyball and beach tennis are two commonly played sports, so get involved if you fancy it!

fields.name: Beach Bars
fields.description: There are a few casual, characterful bars in Stalos. Some spill out on to the sands too, so you can enjoy an ice-cold tipple as the sun goes in. The main thoroughfare is easy to get around by foot. Hop from one restaurant to another, and make the most of your evenings.

fields.name: Botanical Park & Gardens of Crete
fields.description: Get in touch with nature. Fruit trees, ornamental plants and herbs come together in almost 20 hectares of green space. It’s got its own microclimate, which makes it a great home for fauna as well as flora. Expect lots of pretty colours, and a memorial olive tree to commemorate fires from 2003.

fields.name: Cave Nerospilia
fields.description: The Cave of Nerospilia – or "Water Cave" – is home to a set of marvellous stalactites and stalagmites. It was originally a sacred area and place of worship in the age of the Minoans. It’s just over 1km south of the village centre, so it’s not far by car.

fields.name: Camilo Beach
fields.description: A stunning beach surrounded by large rocky cliffs and grottoes that you can swim among, with large arches and coves to float under. At the top of the cliffs there's a small restaurant where you can eat fresh fish overlooking the sands. You can also take a boat tour to explore the many coves.

fields.name: Shopping Boutiques
fields.description: There’s lots of shopping boutiques in Lagos and you can buy anything from fashion and footwear, to local crafts made from ceramic, leather and cork. Head to Candido dos Reis to do a spot of clothes shopping or go looking for some of the hidden gems in Lagos’ maze of narrow streets.

fields.name: Boa Vista Golf Resort
fields.description: The Boa Vista Golf Resort is an 18-hole championship golf course and academy. With stunning views of the ocean, you can bring down your handicap with some one-on-one tuition with a golf expert. The clubhouse restaurant overlooks Lagos bay and its spa has indoor and outdoor pools, a jacuzzi and beauty treatments.

fields.name: Seven Hanging Valleys Walking Trail
fields.description: Pinch-me panoramas are on the cards along this coastal cliff walk with its surf-splashed rock formations and secret coves. Start your journey at Praia da Marinha, and make your way among the juniper bushes and butterflies, keeping your eyes peeled for the amazing Alfanzina Lighthouse. A return trip can take four to six hours, but you don’t have to do the whole thing, and there are plenty of picnic stops along the way.

fields.name: Lara Beach
fields.description: This 8km-long beach is mostly soft and gold with a few patches of darker sand and pebbles that span out in front of the glistening five-star properties. Along from the seafront hotels, there’s a public stretch of beach where you can hire sun loungers and parasols.

fields.name: Alanya Markets
fields.description: Alanya’s most popular market, selling fresh produce from local farmers, is on Friday and is well worth a visit. Compare prices at different stalls first. And don’t forget to haggle! You may be offered a cup of tea. This is a Turkish custom but don’t feel you must buy.

fields.name: Tahtali Aerial Cableway
fields.description: For spectacular views from “Sea to Sky” take the Tahtali Aerial Cableway, Europe’s longest. In 10 minutes you’ll take in panoramas of the Med, Olympos National Park and snow-capped mountains. At the summit, 2,365 metres above sea level, there’s a restaurant for a snack before riding or hiking back down.

fields.name: Kursunlu Falls
fields.description: Kursunlu Falls are perfect when you fancy a break from ancient ruins and the beach. The beautiful waterfalls are set in a cool, peaceful pine forest ideal for a nice walk and if you’re lucky you may even see turtles. So wear your walking shoes, pack a picnic and make a day of it. There are picnic spots along the river.

fields.name: Iztuzu Beach
fields.description: If more than four kilometres of golden sand, crystal clear water and stunning views wasn’t tempting enough, Iztuzu Beach has another special feature that brings the visitors in. Wooden stakes dotted around the beach mark the spots where loggerhead turtles are nesting, so keep your eyes peeled for this beautiful creature.

fields.name: Paspatur Old Town
fields.description: Take a day trip to Paspatur old town and lose yourself in a network of shaded streets. Gift shops selling trinkets sit alongside fashionable boutiques, and pretty Turkish rugs hang on the walls opposite a fruit seller’s stall. This is a great place to shop and to see some sights such as the old mosque.

fields.name: Feithye Markets
fields.description: Every Tuesday, one of the region’s largest markets sets up shop in Fethiye. You can immerse yourself in the atmosphere and haggle for fresh produce, clothing, gifts and accessories, as well as everyday items you may have forgotten. There are also plenty of places to eat to keep up your shopping stamina.

fields.name: Tlos Ruins
fields.description: If you’d like to take in some local history and love exploring by foot, a trip to the ancient settlement of Tlos is for you. There have recently been more archaeological digs at this ruined site, so there is plenty to see including a Roman fortress and baths. The views are beautiful too.

fields.name: Praia da Luz Beach
fields.description: Sardines don’t often get the credit they deserve, except in Olhos d’Agua at the annual Sardine Festival held every August. Enjoy some barbequed sardines on the beach as you chat to the locals and listen to a live Portuguese band. There are even some fireworks after the sun goes down.

fields.name: Day trip to Lisbon
fields.description: Europe’s second oldest city is perfect if you want the best of both worlds – city break and beach holiday. Treat yourself to a Michelin-starred dinner or marvel in the melancholy beauty of Fado while dining, Lisbon is simply bursting with culture. Make sure you visit Belem, home of the Portuguese Tart.

fields.name: Sagres
fields.description: If you prefer a more secluded getaway, you’ll love the laid-back vibe of Sagres where you can take in the rugged landscape of Europe’s most south-westerly point. The striking cliffs of the Cabo de Sao Vincente provide a dramatic backdrop, where you can practice surfing in an area almost untouched by tourism.

fields.name: Monchique Mountains
fields.description: Potter along the narrow cobbled streets enjoying a honey-soaked cake from one of the many cake shops or take in the restorative spa waters at Caldas de Monchique. On a clear day, the views from the top of Foia are some of the best you’ll see – at 902m it’s the highest point in the Algarve.

fields.name: Perissa Beach
fields.description: Visiting Blue Flag Perissa Beach is a must while holidaying in Santorini, as it’s famed as being one of the island’s best spots. Black lava sand carpets the shore and it’s lapped by azure waters if you fancy a refreshing dip. It can get busy here, so it’s best to pitch up and claim your lounger early!

fields.name: Oia's Shops and Galleries
fields.description: Charming Oia is home to many authentic old buildings which house various quaint shops. From bookstores to souvenir sellers, you’ll be spoilt for choice if low-key retail therapy is how you like to fill an afternoon. Art galleries and markets are also dotted around this humble town.

fields.name: Sailing
fields.description: Set out on a sailing tour across the high seas! Fira is a great place to start if you’re up for a boat trip. It’s one of the best ways to see glittering water and rugged coastlines come into frame. Don’t forget your camera – the scenes will be Instagram-worthy.

fields.name: Canava Roussos Winery
fields.description: Around a 30-minute walk from the main beach, you’ll stumble upon this charming, traditional winery. You can take a self-guided tour through the factory or book onto one of the wine tasting sessions and sample the tipples alongside an expert wine connoisseur. The shaded courtyard is the perfect spot to toast your new-found faves.

fields.name: Kalogria Beach
fields.description: Fancy relaxing on a sunbed on the soft white sands? Then head to Kalogria beach. Surrounded by mountains with crystal clear turquoise waters to swim in, this gorgeous beach is a haven for holidaymakers. And if you’re feeling brave, head to the deep rock pools of cold water at the side of the beach for a quick cool down.

fields.name: Harbourside Dining
fields.description: The area around Kalamata Marina is speckled with restaurants dishing up local delights. We’re talking cool cafés, open-top tavernas and everything in between. Pull up a seat under the glistening Grecian sunshine and dine as the boats ripple on the water, or head away from the seafront to hunt down hidden gems.

fields.name: Monemvasia
fields.description: This unmissable attraction is the stunning town of Monemvasia – a large rock linked to the land by a small causeway. You can enter the fascinating fortified village then wander the cobbled alleyways, browse one of the many little boutiques or just sit with a drink and enjoy the once-in-a-lifetime view.

fields.name: Ride the Vintage Railway
fields.description: Don’t miss out on this unique journey through the north of the Peloponnese. The Diakofto–Kalavryta Railway offers a scenic ride through the Vouraïkos Gorge. You’ll see the dramatic cliffs above and rushing rapids below as you pass by some incredible Peloponnese landscapes. So all aboard for a train ride like no other!

fields.name: Lindos Beach
fields.description: The main beach at Lindos is a gorgeous sandy strip overlooked by the impressive Acropolis. This sheltered spot has sun loungers and umbrellas for hire, which you can relax on when you’re not swimming in the clear, calm water. From here you can also take boat trips to neighbouring ports.

fields.name: Snorkelling in St. Paul's Bay
fields.description: Just to the south of Lindos town and overlooked by the Acropolis, St Paul’s Bay is a sheltered spot offering some fantastic snorkelling. As you swim through the clear water, you might come face-to-face with some of the blennies and golden cardinal fish that call this place home.

fields.name: Acropolis of Lindos
fields.description: Lindos is a small but beautiful village in Rhodes which is most famous for its important archaeological site, the Acropolis of Lindos. Take a walk or donkey ride up to the site, where you can soak up some stunning scenery and views, including the Athena Lindia temple.

fields.name: Day trip to Marmaris
fields.description: The Turkish coastal town is only 50 minutes by boat from Rhodes, with ferries running in the morning and evening between the ports (although not on Wednesdays or Thursdays). Explore the peaceful streets of the Old Town or head to one of the many restaurants, cafes and bars in the newer part of town.

fields.name: Water Sports
fields.description: Discover a new hobby at Kamari Beach. The conditions here are ideal for windsurfing, plus there are plenty of schools offering equipment and lessons. Or why not try jet skiing and paragliding? But if the excitement gets too much there are also more family-friendly pedalos to hire.

fields.name: Kamari Bay
fields.description: You won't find any crazy parties at Kamari Bay, but that doesn't mean the village shuts down at night. Instead, you'll find plenty of restaurants offering BBQs on the beach or local tavernas holding quiz nights. But if you fancy a dance there are also some cocktail bars playing live music.

fields.name: Day trip to Bodrum
fields.description: In Bodrum, beaches, boutique hotels and nightclubs sit alongside ancient ruins, Ottoman mosques and a castle. You can take a daytrip to this evocative and elegant seaside town from Kos by boat. The fastest journey time is about an hour and there are crossings up to 14 times a week in season.

fields.name: Fisherman's Beach
fields.description: Fisherman's Beach, or Praia dos Pescadores, is overlooked by a small promenade of shops and restaurants beside Albufeira Old Town. You can access the beach by two escalators and there are sunbeds available to hire too. During the summer, this seafront stretch can become pretty crowded, which gives it a fantastic atmosphere.

fields.name: Eat around the Old Town
fields.description: Albufeira's old town is a cobbled, pedestrianised area that's popular with tourists. There are lots of bars and restaurants to suit every taste and budget and the restaurants in the main square have extensive menus. The narrow back streets hold many of the town’s more traditional restaurants and some hidden gems.

fields.name: Pine Cliffs Golf Course
fields.description: The Pine Cliffs Golf Course overlooks the beautiful beaches of Albufeira and is built in 168 acres of pine wood. This nine-hole course is challenging and famous for the Devil's Parlour, a championship that requires a 197-metre shot over a ravine and clifftops. Beginners can also get tuition from its golf academy.

fields.name: Mimo Cooking School
fields.description: Put your culinary skills to the test at Pine Cliff Hotel’s super swanky cooking school. From Traditional Portuguese Cooking to Michelin Star Secrets, pro chef Lucia has a tasty selection of step-by-step classes to choose from. And the wine tasting trivia nights offer even more mouth-watering experiences.

fields.name: Algar Seco
fields.description: Algar Seco is a superb rock formation set in the waves. A wooden boardwalk links it to Carvoeiro centre which is great for wheelchair access and families with buggies. At sunset, the blowholes, arches and caves set into the limestone fill with colour and you are treated to a spectacular natural light show.

fields.name: Praia do Carvalho
fields.description: Praia do Carvalho is one of the Algarve's best-kept secrets – and rightly so! It’s a magical sandy cove that’s more or less deserted all year round, so you won’t struggle to put down your towel. The steep staircase and narrow path down to the cove add to the hidden-gem feel.

fields.name: Boat Trip
fields.description: The boat trips from Carvoeiro beach explore the coastline and grottos between Carvoeiro and Benagil. The turquoise-caves are almost magical and there are lots of tours to choose from, some with the option to stop and swim. If you choose to stay on the boat, the hour-long tour costs around €20.

fields.name: Vale de Milho Golf
fields.description: The Vale de Milho Golf Course is great for families and beginners as it’s a scaled-down version of a full-sized course with only nine holes. The greens can still be challenging and the 11th hole is 161 metres. The course is perfect for a relaxing game of golf with its beautiful position over the sea.

fields.name: Praia da Rocha Beach
fields.description: A wide wooden boardwalk runs the length of Praia da Rocha beach and it’s sprinkled with restaurants, cafés and bars. As well as all the usual water sports the beach often hosts volleyball and beach football matches. Access is tricky with lots of steps but there’s beach-level access by the marina.

fields.name: Beachfront shops
fields.description: The tiny boutiques and stalls at Praia da Rocha sell mostly holiday essentials and gifts. Try and catch the market on the first Monday of the month as it’s packed of vendors selling lots of local handicrafts and wood carvings. For more commercial shopping, Portimão is 20 minutes’ walk away.

fields.name: Ocean Revival Underwater Park
fields.description: Ocean Revival Underwater Park nearby Portimão is the largest single artificial reef in the world. Snap on a scuba mask and explore the four sunken Navy ships here, which act as a flowerbed for a colourful range of underwater plants and creatures. It’s free to visit, and there are lots of accredited diving schools nearby.

fields.name: Dolphin Watching
fields.description: Get a close-up of the show as local dolphins play and somersault from the waves on a dolphin safari from Portimão marina. Don't forget your camera! If you suffer from sea-sickness, you might be better off going on a day when the waves are relatively calm.

fields.name: Torralta Beach
fields.description: A trip to the Blue Flag Torralta Beach has plenty to please both adults and children. It's perfect for windsurfing and kitesurfing, or gentle pursuits such as swimming and lounging, . It’s also lined with cafés and bars serving up fresh grilled fish and other local specialities.

fields.name: Boat Trip
fields.description: Boat trips are a great way to get away from the hustle and bustle, soak up the sun and enjoy the natural beauty of the Algarve. If you’re an adventurous type, you can opt for a fishing trip and catch your own supper. Romantic types can relax with a half-day or full-day outing, or a sunset river or coastal cruise.

fields.name: Alto Golf
fields.description: Whatever your handicap, the 18-hole Alto golf will test your golfing skills with a range of hazards. There are bunkers, dog-legs and fiendishly positioned trees to negotiate. And look out for the 600 metre par-5 on the 16th, known as the ‘Sir Henry Challenge’, which is thought to be one of the longest holes in Europe.

fields.name: Skydiving
fields.description: Adrenaline junkies can experience a rush like no other and skydive from 14,000 feet above the Algarve’s coastline. Board the plane just outside Alvor at Portimão Municipal Aerodrome and then free-fall for 60 seconds before opening your parachute. The whole thing is filmed so you can relive it again and again.

fields.name: Las Perlas Beach
fields.description: Las Perlas Beach is a Blue Flag beach with bright white sand and clear blue water, just a short stroll from Cancun city centre. Spend some time sunbathing on the beach or have a go at watersports such as windsurfing, water skiing, pedalos, jet skiing and paragliding.

fields.name: Diving at Punta Cancún
fields.description: Punta Cancún is one of the most popular destinations in Cancun to go diving and explore the depths of the Caribbean Sea. As you swim through the clear water, you'll come face-to-face with the colourful coral formations where it is easy to find manta rays, barracudas and sharks that call this place home.

fields.name: Palapas Park
fields.description: If you're looking to spend a day as a Cancunense, you definitely have to go to this place. Located in the heart of the city, just a few blocks from Mercado 28, you can eat Mexican snacks, buy a snow to relieve heat, buy hippie crafts and watch a public show or musical groups, and sometimes there are cultural shows and Recreational Be sure to try the delicious marquesitas, a kind of rolled cream that is usually filled with ball cheese. A typical appetizer of the region.

fields.name: Playa Mujeres Golf Club
fields.description:
Playa Mujeres Golf Club will be recognized as one of the finest courses in Mexico. This 18-hole course features several lagoon and ocean front holes, including 4 holes that actually play from or towards the beautiful white-sand beaches and turquoise colored Ocean of the Mexican Caribbean. There is also a well appointed clubhouse, on-site pro-shop and expert staff help provide for your every need.

Source: https://www.mexicancaribbean.travel/cancun/

fields.name: South Beach
fields.description: South beach is a broad swath of white sands punctuated by colourful lifeguard stands and bordered by Ocean Drive’s iconic cityscape of Art Deco architecture, sidewalk restaurants and boutique hotels. Rent a sun lounger and spend some time sunbathing or have a go at watersports such as windsurfing, water skiing, pedalos, jet skiing and paragliding.

fields.name: Snorkelling & Diving
fields.description: Why just settle for on the water when you can go under it? Miami’s waters are connected to the third-largest barrier reef in the world, the Florida Straits, presenting spectacular opportunities for snorkelling and diving with both natural and artificial reef sites just offshore.

fields.name: Oleta State Park
fields.description: With three miles of nature trails, Oleta is an ideal park for a leisurely hike amid mangroves, gumbo limbo trees and colorful wildflowers. You’ll wind your way along the water toward the beach with beautiful views of Biscayne Bay and the Intracoastal Waterway. Be on the lookout for native butterflies and migratory birds. This is also a prime area to spot manatees and dolphins.

fields.name: Skydiving
fields.description:
If you’ve always wanted to go skydiving, now is your chance. Experience a true bird’s eye unobstructed view of Miami at an elevation of two miles with the Miami Skydiving Center. With an up to 40-second free fall at 120 mph, get ready to have a very intense experience. Do you have the nerves to take the plunge?

Source: https://www.miamiandbeaches.com

fields.name: Sunset Beach
fields.description: Sunset Beach is considered one of the longest stretches of rideable surf in the world. The wide sandy beach provides families a great place to sunbathe and play in the sand. In the winter months, you can watch big-wave surfing with swells up to 30 feet tall, along with the world's premier surfing competitions, including the Vans Triple Crown of Surfing.

fields.name: Snorkelling and Scuba Diving
fields.description: With 1,200 miles of coral reef fringing the Hawaiian Islands, snorkeling and scuba diving are two of the island's most popular water activities. The South Shore of Molokai is home to Hawaii’s longest barrier reef. At 28 miles, these lush underwater gardens are teeming with green sea turtles, spotted eagle rays and a variety of tropical fish.

fields.name: Bishop Museum
fields.description: Located in Honolulu, the Bishop Museum is Hawaii’s largest museum dedicated to studying and preserving the history of Hawaii. Originally designed to house the extensive collection of Hawaiian artifacts and royal family heirlooms of Princess Bernice Pauahi Bishop, a descendent of King Kamehameha I, the museum is now the premier natural and cultural history institution in the Pacific.

fields.name: Haleakala National Park
fields.description:
Spanning 30,004 acres from the coast to its 10,023-foot summit, this park has a larger concentration of endangered species than any other other park in the USA. Haleakala National Park features the dormant volcano, Haleakala, which hasn’t erupted for 400 to 600 years. Explore the otherworldly summit and watch the sunrise, or visit the Kipahulu District on the east side of the island where waterfalls and pools can be seen.

Source: https://www.gohawaii.com

fields.name: Whistler Olympic Park
fields.description: The Nordic venue of the Vancouver 2010 Olympic and Paralympic Winter Games, Whistler Olympic Park offers snow activities for all ages and abilities. Explore the park on cross-country skis or snowshoes, or try biathlon. Rentals, lessons, adult and kids ski camps are available, plus dog-friendly ski and snowshoe trails.

fields.name: Whistler Village
fields.description: Whistler Village is the beating heart of a social community where locals bring their up-for-anything attitude to every shop, restaurant and gathering place – its energy is palpable. True to its bold and cultured character, Whistler’s offering of experiences lets you indulge all of the senses. From the cultural to the culinary, the educational to the entertaining, its boutique shops, museums, restaurants, galleries, events and festivals deliver countless options for all in all seasons.

fields.name: Peak 2 Peak 360 Experience
fields.description: A one-of-a-kind gondola linking Whistler and Blackcomb mountains. Ride the longest continuous lift system in the world, in a glass-bottomed gondola, a mile above the glacial Fitzsimmons Creek. It’s a full day experience with incredible views, hiking trails to explore, free and custom guided tours and places to eat on the mountains. Don’t miss the Inukshuks which make for iconic Whistler photo ops. Be generous with time and take it all in.

fields.name: River of Golden Dreams
fields.description:
Hire a kayak, canoe or stand up paddle board and discover the River of Golden Dreams route which links Alta Lake and Green Lake. The five-kilometre waterway is one of Whistler’s iconic experiences and fun for all the family. Along the route you can see lush wetlands, old growth forest and views of the surrounding mountains. Keep your eyes open for beavers, eagles, osprey, river otter, black bears and plenty of birds.

Source: https://www.whistler.com/

fields.name: Lake Louise Ski Resort
fields.description: The Lake Louise Ski Resort is one of the largest ski areas in North America, offering spectacular views, long runs, and lots of terrain for all ability levels. With 139 runs, there is a huge variety for beginner, intermediate, and expert skiers and riders, making The Lake Louise Ski Resort a great choice for families and groups. Big open bowls and gnarly chutes and gullies offer a lot of fun for intermediate and expert skiers as well.

fields.name: Town of Banff
fields.description: The town of Banff is a spirited place, alive with adventure and wonder. In all directions you’re surrounded by strikingly beautiful and rugged mountains that seem to burst straight out of the ground. The lively streets of downtown are lined with top-class restaurants, bars, and shops, as well as a vibrant range of art galleries and museums. The locals are warm, open, and genuinely connected to the inspiring environment in which they live. The town of Banff offers you endless options for rejuvenation and exploration every day.

fields.name: Lake Louise Gondola
fields.description: The Lake Louise Gondola lifts sightseers into the alpine to experience the expansive beauty of Lake Louise. From the top at 2,088 metres (6,850 feet) elevation, gaze upon the stunning views of Victoria Glacier, or take an award winning interpretive tour to learn more about the area’s natural history and wildlife. Many visitors also remark upon the wildlife that can be seen from the sightseeing lift including grizzly bears that are often seen grazing under its path.

fields.name: Horse Riding Tour
fields.description:
Explore the mountains and Alberta’s outfitting history with a half- or full-day tour offered by one of the horse ranches around Banff and Lake Louise. Seize the opportunity to experience the stunning scenery from the unique perspective on horseback. Take an introductory tour to become more comfortable on horses and experience what the original outfitters might have felt, or join a longer tour as you are led into the wilds around Banff and Lake Louise.

Source: https://www.banfflakelouise.com/

fields.name: Zermatt Town
fields.description: Zermatt’s beautiful old town is characterised by its traditional, 16th century wooden houses, built on flat struts to keep mice away from the family’s grain stores. It’s a car-free town with some lovely churches, cafés and local shops selling chocolate, watches and traditional wood carvings. Narrow streets decked with colourful flowers and horse-drawn carriages add to its rustic feel and charm.

fields.name: Matterhorn Glacier
fields.description: Let Europe’s highest cable car whisk you up into the breathtaking glacial scenery of the Matterhorn. You’ll get to see glorious 360-degree views of Italy, France and Switzerland from the viewing platform at the top. While you're up there, make sure you visit the glacier palace, an icy wonderland carved out of the inside of the glacier.

fields.name: Matterhorn Ski Paradise
fields.description: At almost 4000 metres of altitude, Matterhorn ski paradise is the highest winter sports area in the Alps. With its guaranteed snow conditions, the region is one of the best-developed and most expansive ski resorts anywhere in the world. There are a range of winter activities on offer including snowshoeing, ice skating, tobogganing and heli-skiing.

fields.name: Schwarzee Lake
fields.description: A scenic gondola trip to the beautiful Schwarzee lake which lies right at the foot of the Matterhorn. At the top you’ll find a restaurant with spectacular views of the famous Hörnligrat ridge on the Matterhorn, the Hörnli hut and the village of Zermatt way below. There is also a 4km walking trail that winds around the lake, as well as some trickier hiking paths if you're feeling active.

fields.name: Wine Tasting in the Hunter Valley
Watch the Phillip Island Penguin Parade
Wine Tasting in the Yarra Valley
Explore the Valley of the Winds
Visit Kings Canyon Garden of Eden
Wine Tasting in the Barossa Valley
Ride on the Pichi Richi Railway
Walk With the Sea Lions on Kangaroo Island
Wine Tasting in the Fraser Valley
Skiing And Snowboarding on Grouse Mountain
Arrive in Toronto and Welcome Meal
fields.description: On arrival at Toronto Pearson International Airport, a transfer will take you to your hotel. Here you will meet your fellow travellers and enjoy a Welcome Meal.

fields.name: Toronto Attractions and Sports Game
fields.description: Visit the CN Tower, Royal Ontario Museum, Art Gallery of Ontario, and Queen's Park, home to the Ontario Parliament Buildings. Discover the shops, cafes, and restaurants in Kensington Markets which are packed with goods from around the world. End your day by watching a game from one of Toronto's many professional sports teams.

fields.name: Niagra Falls and Niagra-on-the-Lake
fields.description: Take the train to the spectacular Niagara Falls. Experience the breathtaking views of this great natural wonder up-close on a cruise to the base of the falls. Explore the food and wine in Niagara-on-the-Lake before returning to Toronto.

fields.name: Ottawa Attractions and Food Tour
fields.description: Travel to to the Canadian capital of Ottawa where you’ll visit the federal parliament buildings on Parliament Hill, the Ottawa Art Gallery, the Diefenbunker Museum and the Vanier Museoparc. Experience a walking food tour, with C’est Bon Cooking Food Tours.

fields.name: Toronto Beaches and Waterfront
fields.description: Discover the trails, beaches and amusement park on Toronto Islands and browse the shops on the waterfront. An evening transfer will take you to Toronto Pearson International Airport for your flight home.

fields.name: Arrive in Vancouver and Welcome Meal
fields.description: On arrival at Vancouver International Airport, a transfer will take you to your hotel. Here you will meet your fellow travellers and enjoy a Welcome Meal.

fields.name: Attractions and Kayak Tour
fields.description: Visit Science World, Vancouver Art Gallery and Vancouver Aquarium. Take a kayak tour with Sea Dragon Charters and see the seals, otters, eagles, and fish while enjoying exercise, fresh sea air and amazing views of downtown Vancouver.

fields.name: Fraser Valley Wine Tour and Gastown
fields.description: Experience a tour of the Fraser Valley wine region and enjoy private tastings of some of Canada's best wines. Explore the fashion, homewares and gift shops in Gastown, which is home to the city's coolest independent fashion studios.

fields.name: Grouse Mountain
fields.description: Travel to Grouse Mountain and enjoy panoramic views as you travel to the alpine aboard the iconic Skyride. Experience world class skiing and snowboarding, the stunning light installations on the Light Walk, the slopes at the Sliding Zone, the outdoor skating pond, snowshoeing and more.

fields.name: Stanley Park
fields.description: Discover the trails, beaches, gardens, lakes and the totem pole display in Stanley Park. An evening transfer will take you to Vancouver International Airport for your flight home.

fields.name: Arrive in Brisbane
fields.description: On arrival at Brisbane International Airport, a transfer will take you to your hotel. Here you will meet your fellow travellers and enjoy a welcome meal.

fields.name: Brisbane City Attractions
fields.description: Explore the Museum of Brisbane where you can find out about the city's history, browse over 100 specialty boutiques at Fortitude Valley and visit Lola Pine Koala Sanctuary where you can see some of Australia's most exotic  wildlife. End your day by exploring the market stalls, entertainment and street food eateries from around the world at Brisbane's markets.

fields.name: Gold Coast
fields.description: Spend the day at Surfers Paradise on the iconic Gold Coast where you will be able to explore the golden beaches, learn how to surf, explore the epic theme parks and enjoy the outstanding local cuisine.

fields.name: Fraser Island
fields.description: Explore the 75 Mile Beach known as the freeway, before detouring inland discovering freshwater lakes, floating down lazy rivers and exploring the stunning rainforest. You'll enjoy an overnight stay on the island at a campsite just minutes from the beach.

fields.name: Rainbow Beach
fields.description: After 2 days on Fraser Island, you will head back to the mainland and spend the day at Rainbow Beach, one of Australia's top surf spots. This quiet Queensland town is the perfect place to paddle out and learn how to how to surf. There will also be the opportunity to explore the beach and Carlo Sandblow.

fields.name: Whitsunday Islands
fields.description: Your next destination will be the Whitsunday Islands, 74 paradise islands off the Queensland coast, where you will get to take in the epic views from the boat as you travel around the islands. There will also be opportunity to explore the white sands and turquoise water at Whitsundays Beach and spend some time swimming and snorkelling these crystal clear waters.

fields.name: Atherton Tablelands
fields.description: Now it's time to travel up to Cairns and explore the waterfalls and rainforests of the Atherton Tablelands and slide down natural water slides and swim in volcanic crater lakes, all whilst learning some pretty cool things about this phenomenal landscape. There will also be the opportunity to go skydiving or white water rafting.

fields.name: The Great Barrier Reef
fields.description:
Spend the day snorkelling, scuba diving and exploring the underwater world of the Great Barrier Reef. In the evening, you will have a farewell meal at one of the best restaurants in Cairns. The next morning a transfer will take you to Cairns Airport for your flight home.

Sources: https://www.welcometo.travel/tour/the-east-coast-mid-semester/ and https://www.australia.com/en-gb

fields.name: Arrive in Melbourne
fields.description: On arrival at Melbourne International Airport, a transfer will take you to your hotel. Here you will meet your fellow travellers and enjoy a welcome meal.

fields.name: Melbourne City Attractions
fields.description: Explore the Victoria State Library, Australian Music Vault and take a lift to the top of the Eureka Skydeck where you will be able to experience amazing views of Melbourne and beyond from the highest viewing platform in the Southern Hemisphere. You will also have the opportunity to visit the Melbourne Museum where you can gain an insight into life in Victoria, tour the Melbourne Cricket Ground and browse the food, souvenirs and clothing at the Queen Victoria Market.

fields.name: Phillip Island
fields.description: Explore Phillip Island where you will see the Penguin Parade where you can catch a glimpse of the island's native little penguins as they come back ashore after a day of fishing. There will also be the opportunity to take a trip around the island to see the seals, dolphins, whales and a range of birdlife in their natural habitat and explore the beaches where you can spend some time swimming and surfing.

fields.name: St Kilda
fields.description: Your next destination will be St Kilda where you will get to explore the stalls at the St Kilda Esplanade Arts and Craft Market, experience the rides at the iconic Luna Park. There will also be the opportunity to see some live music at the Palais Theatre or a show at National Theatre and spend some time at the beach sunbathing, swimming or learning to sail or surf.

fields.name: Great Ocean Road
fields.description: Your next destination will be the Great Ocean Road, one of Australia’s most beautiful and famous drives. Experience the ancient rainforest in the Otways, see the koalas in Kennett River, visit the beach at Apollo Bay and take in the epic views Twelve Apostles and Loch Ard Gorge.

fields.name: The Grampians
fields.description: Now it's time to travel on to the Grampians National Park and explore the rugged rock landscapes, scenic lookouts and First Nations culture. Visit the Brambuk Aboriginal Culture Centre to learn about an important period of this ancient culture known as the Dreaming and hike up to the Pinnacles for impressive views across the Grampians.

fields.name: Ballarat and Hepburn Springs
fields.description: Explore the city of Ballarat which is built on the riches of the world's largest alluvial gold deposit where you can visit the Art Gallery of Ballarat which has one of the largest collections of Australian paintings and see native Australian animals in their natural habitat at Ballarat Wildlife Park. There will also be the opportunity to visit Creswick Woollen Mills which is the last coloured woollen spinning mill in Australia and spend some time at Hepburn Springs where you can soak in mineral springs at the historic Hepburn Bathhouse and Spa.

fields.name: Wine Tasting
fields.description:
Experience a tour of the De Bortoli winery in the Yarra Valley wine region where you will be able to see how premium wine is made on a behind-the-scenes tour and sample some of Australia's best wines. In the evening, a transfer will take you back to Melbourne International Airport for your flight home. 

Sources: https://www.adventuretours.travel/uk/australia/great-ocean-road-adventure-ex-melbourne-127041 https://www.australia.com/en-gb/ https://www.visitvictoria.com/regions/melbourne/destinations/st-kilda

fields.name: Arrive in Sydney
fields.description: On arrival at Sydney International Airport, a transfer will take you to your hotel. Here you will meet your fellow travellers and enjoy a welcome meal.

fields.name: Sydney City Attractions
fields.description: Explore the Sydney Opera House, Australian Museum and visit Taronga Zoo where you will be able to see over 4,000 animals, including Australian native wildlife and rare and endangered exotic animals. You will also have the opportunity to go on a costal walk from Bondi Beach to Coogee Beach and discover Sydney's markets and browse the food, souvenirs, clothing, jewellery, art and more.

fields.name: Blue Mountains
fields.description: Your next destination will be Blue Mountains where you will get to discover lookouts with sensational views over million-year-old valleys, go beneath the ground at Jenolan Caves, hike or bike through lush rainforest, and take a heart-stopping ride at Scenic World.

fields.name: Canberra
fields.description: Now it's time to travel on to Canberra, Australia's capital, where you will be able to explore the National Gallery of Australia, the fun science centre Questacon, the National Library of Australia and the Museum of Australian Democracy at Old Parliament House. There will also be the opportunity to visit the Capital Region Farmers Market.  and browse the truffles to craft beers and smoked meats.

fields.name: Wine Tasting
fields.description: Experience a tour of the Tyrrell's Wines in the Hunter Valley wine region where you will be able to see how premium wine is made on a behind-the-scenes tour and sample some of Australia's best wines.

fields.name: Port Stephens
fields.description: Visit Port Stephens and explore the golden beaches and spend some time swimming, surfing and snorkelling, and discover the largest moving coastal dunes in the Southern Hemisphere. There will also be the opportunity to go on a hike to Tomaree Head and take in the spectacular views of the bay, beaches and beyond.

fields.name: Mudgee
fields.description: Start the day by watching the sunrise above the vineyards in a hot-air balloon and then spend some time hiking in the Wollemi National Park, where you will discover the scenic canyons, towering cliffs, wild rivers and serene forests in the largest wilderness area in New South Wales. There will also be the opportunity to enjoy the local produce in the cafes and pubs and restaurants in Mudgee.

fields.name: Avoca Beach
fields.description:
Discover the Rockpool at Avoca Beach and spend some time swimming, surfing and kayaking. There will also be the opportunity to go on a diving tour of the Ex-HMAS Adelaide, a warship scuttled in 2011 and now teeming with sea life. You will then travel to Newcastle to have a farewell meal and a transfer will take you to Newcastle Airport for your flight home.

Source: https://www.visitnsw.com/

fields.name: Arrive in Darwin
fields.description: On arrival at Darwin International Airport, a transfer will take you to your hotel. Here you will meet your fellow travellers and enjoy a welcome meal.

fields.name: Nitmiluk Gorge
fields.description: Explore the Nitmiluk Gorge via canoe, hop on a local cruise or take a scenic helicopter flight above the ancient gorge system. Hike over volcanic rocks through monsoon forest, before reaching the base of the Southern Rockhole falls, a perfect spot for a swim.

fields.name: Uluru
fields.description: Your next destination will be Uluru where you will get to take in the breath taking sight of the World’s Largest Rock and complete a Base Walk around Uluru. Discover the Mala Walk, Mutijulu Waterhole and Aboriginal Cave Paintings.

fields.name: Kata Tjuta
fields.description: Explore the Valley of the Winds at Kata Tjuta and learn about the formations the spiritual significance of this special area. Visit the Aboriginal Cultural Centre where you can listen to tales from the ‘Tjukurpa’ Dreamtime and browse the local artwork and souvenirs in the stores managed by traditional owners.

fields.name: Kings Canyon
fields.description: Take a tour with an Aboriginal elder through the sandstone domes to learn about the significance of the area to its traditional owners. There will also be the opportunity to go on a hike through the many Amphitheatres, North & South Walls and the beautiful Garden of Eden, which offers spectacular views of the gorge and surrounding landscape below.

fields.name: Alice Springs
fields.description:
Spend the day discovering the Aboriginal Art Galleries, Kangaroo Sanctuary and Alice Springs Brewery. In the evening, you will have a farewell meal at one of the best restaurants in Alice Springs. The next morning a transfer will take you to Alice Springs Airport for your flight home.

Sources: https://www.ultimate.travel/australia-tour-packages/red-centre-tour/ and https://www.australia.com/en-gb/

fields.name: Arrive in Auckland
fields.description: On arrival at Auckland International Airport, a transfer will take you to your hotel. Here you will meet your fellow travellers and enjoy a welcome meal.

fields.name: Auckland Attractions
fields.description: Take a lift to the viewing platform at the top of the Auckland sky tower and see magnificent views of the city and surrounding area, explore the Maori history and traditions at the Auckland Museum and browse the jewellery, art, gifts, food and clothing at the markets. There will also be the opportunity to go diving, snorkeling or kayaking at the Goat Island Marine Reserve and see New Zealand's marine life up close.

fields.name: Coromandel Peninsula
fields.description: Explore the Coromandel Peninsula which includes the famous Cathedral Cove which is featured in multiple Hollywood films. You will be able to enjoy a picnic on the beach or have a go at some swimming, kayaking, snorkelling, scuba diving.

fields.name: Mount Maunganui
fields.description: Now it's time to explore Mount Maunganui where you can spend the day exploring the mountain, have a picnic by the beach and learn how to surf. There is also the opportunity to go on a dolphin tour or discover the lively array of cafés, restaurants, shops and the Gourmet Night Market in the resort town.

fields.name: Rotorua
fields.description: Experience the Māori culture, hospitality and food in Rotorua and try a hangi feast cooked in the steaming ground or take a tour of an authentic pre-European village. There will also be the opportunity to take in the epic views of the landscape whilst relaxing in a  bubbling mud pool or  natural hot spring. For thrill seekers, Rotorua is home to the highest commercially rafted waterfall in the world, and offers everything from bungy jumping and luging to zorbing and ziplining.

fields.name: Taupo
fields.description: Explore Lake Taupo, New Zealand's largest, where you can see the Maori rock carvings at Mine Bay from the water, and the magnificent Huka Falls, where more than 220,000 litres of water thunder over the cliff face every second.There is also the opportunity to go water-skiing, sailing and kayaking in the lake or hiking and mountain biking in the forests surrounding the lake.

fields.name: Wellington
fields.description: Your next destination will be Wellington where you can visit Oriental Bay, Wellington’s golden-sand inner-city beach, discover the many museum and art galleries and theatre shows. There will also be the opportunity to ride the cable car up the hill to Kelburn for amazing views over the city and enjoy an ice cream at the top. There are plenty of outdoor activities in and around Wellington such as mountain biking, kayaking, as well as beautiful walks around the harbour and surrounding hills.

fields.name: New Plymouth
fields.description: After two days in Wellington, you will travel on to New Plymouth where you can explore the Puke Arik museum and heritage centre and the Govett-Brewster Art Gallery. There will also be the opportunity to go for a hike in Egmont National Park which encompasses the huge volcano Taranaki and offers lush waterfalls, rainforests and mossy swamps.

fields.name: Waitomo and Raglan
fields.description: Explore the world famous Glowworm caves of Waitomo. Here you will explore the rainforests and take a tour of the waterfalls and caves by going Black Water Rafting. You will also get the opportunity to learn how to surf at Raglan.

fields.name: Auckland
fields.description:
Take a ferry to Waiheke Island, and discover the beautiful vineyards, olive groves, farmland and golden beaches. Sample some of the region's award-winning wines and pick up superb local artwork. In the afternoon, a transfer will take you to Auckland International Airport for your flight home.

Source: https://www.newzealand.com

fields.name: Arrive in New York
fields.description: On arrival at New York John F. Kennedy International Airport, a transfer will take you to your hotel. Here you will meet your fellow travellers and enjoy a Welcome Meal.

fields.name: Satue of Liberty and Museums
fields.description: Take a ferry to Ellis Island and take a tour of the island and the Statue of Liberty. After returning to the mainland, visit some of New York's many museums in Manhattan including Metropolitan Museum of Art, the Museum of Modern Art’s modern and the American Museum of Natural History and marvel at the rich collections on display.

fields.name: Time Squares and Broadway
fields.description: Explore the shops in Times Square and visit the world-famous Madame Tussauds wax figure attraction which has over 200 wax figures of famous musicians. Take a trip to the top of the Empire State Building where you can see spectacular views of New York and the surrounding area. Experience Grand Central Terminal, a unique architectural gem and the city’s major transportation hub. End your day by enjoying a show at one of the many theatres on Broadway.

fields.name: Central Park and Bronx Zoo
fields.description: Visit Central Park, the city’s urban park centrepiece, and discover the meadows, arches and sculptures, running paths and playgrounds. Hire a bike and take a relaxing ride through Central Park or take a guided tour to find out the history of the Park. Explore Bronx Zoo, the USA’s largest metropolitan zoo, where you’ll see everything from American bison to baboons.

fields.name: Brooklyn & Madison Square Garden
fields.description: Walk across the Brooklyn Bridge where you can take in the epic views of New York Harbor and the city’s skylines. Explore the Brooklyn Museum where you can learn about the history of New York and the USA. Take a tour of Madison Square Garden, the home of the New York Knicks.

fields.name: Fifth Avenue, Union Square and Maddison Square
fields.description:
Visit Fifth Avenue, Union Square and Maddison Square and spend the day doing some shopping. Then head down to the world-renowned ‘Shake Shack’ for a bite to eat. In the evening, a transfer will take you to New York John F. Kennedy International Airport for your flight home.

https://www.visittheusa.co.uk/destination/new-york-city/

https://www.thetravel.com/10-day-itinerary-new-york/

fields.name: Arrive in Chiago
fields.description: On arrival at Chicago O’Hare International Airport, a transfer will take you to your hotel. Here you will meet your fellow travellers and enjoy a Welcome Meal.

fields.name: Attractions
fields.description: Explore the Bean, Chicago Design Museum, the Museum of Contemporary Photography and the Chicago Sport Museum, where you can learn about the world of Chicago sports from hi-tech simulated experiences and a collection of unique sports memorabilia.

fields.name: Goose Island Brewery and Lakefront
fields.description: Visit Goose Island brewery where you will be able to see how the beer is made on a behind-the-scenes tour and enjoy a pint. In the afternoon, go for a walk on Chicago’s Lakefront Trail, where you can take in the magnificent views of Chicago's skyline and harbour.

fields.name: Shopping and Shakespeare Theatre
fields.description: Spend the day doing some shopping at Wicker Park and Logan Square where you can find boutiques, thrift shops, and flagship stores selling a range of clothing, art, jewellery and gifts. In the evening, enjoy a show at Chicago's Shakespeare Theatre.

fields.name: Wabash Arts Corridor
fields.description:
Visit the Wabash Arts Corridor where you can see the street art which reflects a variety of artistic styles featuring themes ranging from cultural heritage to social political statements. In the evening, a transfer will take you to Chicago O’Hare International Airport for your flight home. 

Source: https://www.choosechicago.com/

fields.name: Arrive in Montréal
fields.description: On arrival at Montréal Trudeau International Airport, a transfer will take you to your hotel. Here you will meet your fellow travellers and enjoy a Welcome Meal.

fields.name: Museums and Ausgang Plaza
fields.description: Explore the Heritage Gallery, Montréal Aviation Museum and the Écomusée du fier monde whare you can learn about Quebec's industrial history. There will also be the opportunity to visit the Ausgang Plaza, a fringe performance and event venue showcasing an exciting calendar of cultural goings-on for all walks of life.

fields.name: Mount Royal
fields.description: Visit Mount Royal where you can explore the magnificent green space and take part in some of the many recreational activities on offer including cycling, boating, skating, skiing, and tobogganing. There will also be the opportunity to go on a hike up to the mountain's summit where you can take in in the breathtaking views of the city and explore Smith House where you can learn about the history of this unique natural landmark.

fields.name: Ottawa Attractions and Food Tour
fields.description: Travel to to the Canadian capital of Ottawa where you’ll visit the federal parliament buildings on Parliament Hill, the Ottawa Art Gallery, the Diefenbunker Museum and the Vanier Museoparc. Experience a walking food tour, with C’est Bon Cooking Food Tours.

fields.name: Biodôme and Boutiques
fields.description: Explore the Biodôme de Montréal and discover five of North America’s most diverse ecosystems in a completely renewed and grandiose architectural space. Discover the boutiques on Wellington Street which offer everything, from fashion and design to sporting goods and specialty items.

fields.name: Heritage Museums and Canadian Railway Museum
fields.description: Visit La Guilde, and Galerie Le Chariot where you can discover the collection of over 2000 Inuit and Iroquois sculptures which are on display. Explore the Canadian Railway Museum where you will have the opportunity to discover the collection of 188 railway vehicles and learn about the history of the railways in Canada.

fields.name: Old Montreal
fields.description:
Take a stroll through Old Montreal and take in performances of the many street artists and musicians. In the evening, a transfer will take you to Montréal Trudeau International Airport for your flight home. 

Source: https://www.mtl.org/

fields.name: Arrive in Madrid
fields.description: On arrival at Madrid Barajas International Airport, a transfer will take you to your hotel. Here you will meet your fellow travellers and enjoy a Welcome Meal.

fields.name: Attractions and San Miguel Market
fields.description: Explore Almudena Cathedral, the Teatro Real and the Royal Palace, the home of Spain's King where you can watch the changing of the guard. Stop off at the San Miguel market and take part in activities and exhibitions or enjoy a snack or a drink.

fields.name: Paseo del Prado and Royal Botanical Gardens
fields.description: Discover the many museums on Paseo del Prado which include the Reina Sofía National Art Museum, the Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum and the Prado Museum. In the afternoon, explore the neo-Gothic architecture in the Royal Botanical Gardens.

fields.name: Santiago Bernabéu Stadium and Gran Vía
fields.description: Take a tour of Real Madrid's home at Santiago Bernabéu Stadium and learn about the history of the club. Spend the afternoon doing some shopping on Gran Vía which is lined with some of Madrid's most sought-after shops including traditional boutiques, retail chains and international brands.

fields.name: Plaza Mayor Square
fields.description:
Visit Plaza Mayor square which has been a symbol of Madrid since the 17th century and features a statue of King Felipe III in the middle and arcades run around the edges. Underneath the arcades there are traditional shops, as well as a wealth of bars and restaurants. In the afternoon, a transfer will take you to Madrid Barajas International Airport for your flight home.

Sources: https://www.esmadrid.com/en/ and https://www.spain.info/en/

fields.name: Arrive in Paris
fields.description: On arrival at Paris Charles de Gaulle International Airport, a transfer will take you to your hotel. Here you will meet your fellow travellers and enjoy a Welcome Meal.

fields.name: Attractions & Dauphine Market
fields.description: Visit the Arc de Triomphe, the Conciergerie, and the Montparnasse Tower Observation Deck where you can take in the spectacular views of Paris. In the afternoon, discover the Dauphine Market which has over 150 stalls filled with a range of specialties including watches, jewellery, art, music, books, fashion and more.

fields.name: Eiffel Tour, Museums & Luxembourg Gardens
fields.description: Explore the Eiffel Tour, the Museum of Science and Industry and the Louvre Museum which houses over  35,000 western works of art dating from the Middle Ages to 1848. Spend the afternoon discovering the Luxembourg Gardens and it's statues, orchards, greenhouses and forests.

fields.name: Arrive in San Francisco
fields.description: On arrival at San Francisco International Airport, a transfer will take you to your hotel. Here you will meet your fellow travellers and enjoy a Welcome Meal.

fields.name: Attractions and Alamo Square
fields.description: Explore the Cartoon Art Museum, Madame Tussauds, the Museum of 3D Illusions, where the over 40 optical illusions make for great photo opportunities are at every corner of the museum. In the afternoon, visit Alamo Square where can discover the walking trails and catch a glimpse of the row houses, the Painted Ladies, which are featured in the popular 80’s sitcom “Full House”.

fields.name: The Rock and Fisherman's Wharf
fields.description: Take a ferry to the rock and explore Alcatraz, where some of the United States’ most notorious criminals were incarcerated. Visit Fisherman's Wharf where you can catch a glimpse of the sea lions and discover the over 60 specialty shops which sell everything from saltwater taffy to custom-blended spices and hand-crafted jewellery.

fields.name: Golden Gate Bridge
fields.description: Visit Clarion Alley where you can see the street art which reflects a variety of artistic styles featuring themes ranging from cultural heritage to social political statements. Walk across the Golden Gate Bridge where you can take in the epic views of San Francisco Bay and the city’s skylines and discover Golden Gate Park.

fields.name: Union Square
fields.description:
Discover the shops on Union Square where you'll find everything from international brands to boutiques, spas and restaurants housed in beautifully restored Victorian buildings. In the evening, a transfer will take you to San Francisco International Airport for your flight home. 

Source: https://www.sftravel.com/

fields.name: Arrive in Hobart
fields.description: On arrival at Hobart International Airport, a transfer will take you to your hotel. Here you will meet your fellow travellers and enjoy a welcome meal.

fields.name: Hobart City Attractions
fields.description: Begin your exploration of the beautiful island of Tasmania with a city sights tour of its capital Hobart. Visit the Botanic Gardens, waterfront galleries and markets, historic Battery Point, and Constitution Dock. Hike up Mount Wellington and take in the astounding views of the city, Bruny Island and the Tasman Peninsula.

fields.name: Mount Field National Park & Lake St. Clair
fields.description: Explore the wildlife, wilderness and the tiered cascade of Russell Falls in Mt Field National Park. Then take the winding road to iconic Lake St. Clair and The Wall in the Wilderness, a monumental sculpture hand-carved in rare Huon pine.

fields.name: Strahan & Sarah Island
fields.description: Discover the seaside town of Strahan and take a cruise on the Gordon River where you'll get to see the dark waters, stained amber by buttongrass tannins, which reflect the untouched wilderness. Stop off at Sarah Island for an insight into a relic of Tasmania’s convict history, and see Hells Gates, the notoriously treacherous entrance to the harbour.

fields.name: Cradle Mountain
fields.description: Marvel at the inspiring beauty of Cradle Mountain National Park and visit to the Waldheim Chalet for insight into the early history of the Cradle Mountain area. Take a guided walk by Dove Lake where you'll get to see the Bennetts wallabies, echidnas and pademelons grazing along the way. There will also be the opportunity to take a guided tour with a local expert through the Hellyers Road Whisky Distillery in Burnie.

fields.name: Launceston
fields.description:
Your next destination will be Launceston where you'll get to discover the magnificent Cataract
Gorge before taking a scenic drive through rolling hills to Josef Chromy Wines for a wine-tasting tour. There will also be the opportunity to take a cruise on the beautiful Tamar River.

fields.name: Freycinet
fields.description: Visit Bridestowe Lavender Estate and treat yourself to its famous lavender ice cream. Continue south along the picturesque coast to Freycinet National Park and experience a cruise along the coast of the stunning Freycinet Peninsula which will take you from the gentle shores of Coles Bay past towering pink granite cliffs to Wineglass Bay, a flawless crescent of dazzling white sand.

fields.name: Port Arthur & Hobart
fields.description:
Explore the Port Arthur Historic Site, taking a cruise around the Isle of the Dead and a walk through the infamous convict prison. In the evening, you will have a farewell meal at one of the best restaurants in Hobart. The next morning a transfer will take you to Hobart International Airport for your flight home.

Sources: https://www.kuoni.co.uk/ https://www.australia.com/en-gb/  https://www.discovertasmania.com.au/

fields.name: Arrive in Auckland
fields.description: On arrival at Auckland International Airport, a transfer will take you to your hotel. Here you will meet your fellow travellers and enjoy a welcome meal.

fields.name: Auckland
fields.description: Take a lift to the viewing platform at the top of the Auckland sky tower and see magnificent views of the city and surrounding area, explore the Maori history and traditions at the Auckland Museum and browse the jewellery, art, gifts, food and clothing at the markets. There will also be the opportunity to go diving, snorkeling or kayaking at the Goat Island Marine Reserve and see New Zealand's marine life up close.

fields.name: Wellington
fields.description: Today you will make the journey south to Wellington, where you can visit Oriental Bay, Wellington’s golden-sand inner-city beach, and discover the many museums, art galleries and theatre shows. There will also be the opportunity to ride the cable car up the hill to Kelburn for amazing views over the city and enjoy an ice cream at the top. There are plenty of outdoor activities in and around Wellington such as mountain biking, kayaking, as well as beautiful walks around the harbour and surrounding hills.

fields.name: Kaikoura
fields.description: After four days exploring the North Island, you will cross the Cook Strait to the South Island. Explore the picturesque coastal town of Kaikoura, which is the perfect place for marine life encounters, coastal walks, and tucking into a plate of crayfish.

fields.name: Franz Josef
fields.description: Spend the following two days getting up and close to the magnificent Franz Josef Glacier, which is widely regarded as the gem of New Zealand's West Coast Glaciers, and one of the most impressive sights to be found anywhere in the world. You'll go on a hike up to the view point where you can see the icy wonderlands about 750m away and there will be the opportunity to go on a heli-tour to the top of the glacier where you can take in the epic views.

fields.name: Queenstown
fields.description: Queenstown is arguably the adventure capital of the world and for the next two days, you will get to know why! There's bungy jumping, skiing, snowboarding, skydiving, jet-boating... the list of bucket-list and adrenaline activities available in Queenstown is limitless! If your not into the adventure stuff, don’t sweat, Queenstown has an abundance of natural sights and wonders to explore.

fields.name: New Plymouth & Hobbiton
fields.description: Say ‘Haere Rā’ to the South and catch the ferry back to the North Island. Travel north to the beautiful Taranaki region and its capital, New Plymouth, where you can explore the Puke Arik museum and heritage centre and the Govett-Brewster Art Gallery. You'll also have visit Hobbiton where you can discover the World famous movie set.

fields.name: Auckland
fields.description: Take a ferry to Waiheke Island, and discover the beautiful vineyards, olive groves, farmland and golden beaches. Sample some of the region's award-winning wines and pick up superb local artwork. In the afternoon, a transfer will take you to Auckland International Airport for your flight home.

fields.name: Arrive in Dublin
fields.description: On arrival at Dublin International Airport, a transfer will take you to your hotel. Here you will meet your fellow travellers and enjoy a Welcome Meal.

fields.name: Trinity College
fields.description: Visit Trinity College and discover the Douglas Hyde Gallery, the Science Gallery and the Long Room Library, which which houses over 200,000 of Trinity's oldest manuscripts, including the majestic Book of Kells – an illuminated gospel from the 9th century.

fields.name: Irish Emigration Museum & Brazen Head
fields.description: Explore the Irish Emigration Museum where you can delve into the past of Ireland's diaspora and learn about the inspiring journeys of over 10 million people who left Ireland's shores throughout history. Head to the Brazen Head for live traditional music, great food and company – in what some say is the oldest pub in Dublin.

fields.name: Guinness Storehouse & Phoenix Park
fields.description: Take a tour of the Guinness Storehouse exhibition and learn on everything from retro advertising to the craft of brewing. Stop off at the 360-degree Gravity Bar and enjoy a pint of the “Black Stuff". In the afternoon, hire a bike and take a relaxing ride through Phoenix Park, one of Europe’s largest enclosed city parks, where you can see the deer and explore the gardens.

fields.name: Little Museum of Dublin
fields.description:
Discover the Little Museum of Dublin where you can learn about the history of the city in the 20th century through a collection of photography, letters, advertising and art donated by Dubliners themselves. In the afternoon, a transfer will take you to Dublin International Airport for your flight home.

Source: https://www.ireland.com

fields.name: Arrive in Perth
fields.description: On arrival at Perth International Airport, a transfer will take you to your hotel. Here you will meet your fellow travellers and enjoy a welcome meal.

fields.name: Perth
fields.description: Explore the Perth Cultural Centre, Perth Institute of Contemporary Arts, the Perth Mint and The Swan Bell Tower, home to the largest musical instrument in the Southern Hemisphere. You can also go for a swim or stroll along Perth’s famous Norfolk-pine framed Cottesloe Beach and enjoy a sunset drink at the Cottesloe Beach Hotel.

fields.name: Boddington & Wave Rock
fields.description: Journey through the Golden Outback to Boddington, the site of Australia’s largest gold mine. Continue to Wave Rock, a magnificent rock formation formed over three million years ago.

fields.name: Coolgardie
fields.description: Take a farm tour to learn about station life in the outback. Pass through the former gold boomtown of Coolgardie and continue to Kalgoorlie for spectacular views over the famous Super Pit open-cut gold mine, and an orientation tour of this historic town.

fields.name: Cape Le Grand National Park
fields.description: Visit Cape Le Grand National Park and discover wild coastal scenery, rugged granite peaks, sweeping heathlands and white sand beaches. At stunning Lucky Bay, you may see some of the local kangaroos that like to laze on the pristine beach.

fields.name: Albany
fields.description: Explore the seaside town of Albany and discover the Albany Whale Museum, the Brig Amity and Albany Heritage Park. There will also be the opportunity to visit the acclaimed National Anzac Centre overlooking the harbour, from which over 41,000 men and women departed Australia for the Great War.

fields.name: Margaret River
fields.description: The Margaret River region is known around the world for its top quality wines and food. Today, you’ll take a tour of a vineyard and sample some of Australia's best wines. You'll also get to enjoy a lunch prepared from fresh local produce.

fields.name: Freemantle
fields.description: Explore the colourful Fremantle Markets where you can purchase local arts and crafts and taste local produce. Take a stroll along the Fremantle foreshore to observe the impressive fishing fleet. There will also be the opportunity to take a ferry to Rottnest Island and discover the nature reserve.

fields.name: Yanchep National Park & Geraldton
fields.description: Travel north along the coast, stopping in Yanchep National Park for an Aboriginal Cultural Experience with Derek Nannup a member of the local Nyoongar community. Continue along the coast past the seaside hamlet of Lancelin pausing to see the marvellous Pinnacles, a series of intriguing limestone formations. Explore the seaside township of Geraldton and visit the evocative HMAS Sydney Memorial.

fields.name: Monkey Mia & Kalbarri National Park
fields.description:
Watch the famous Monkey Mia dolphins swim into shore to be fed. Later, visit Shell Beach, formed by billions of cockle shells up to ten metres deep. Continue to Hamelin Pool to discover a unique colony
of Stromatolites. In Kalbarri National Park witness the spectacular scenery of the Murchison River Gorge. During wildflower season the National Park flourishes with blooms.

fields.name: Perth
fields.description:
Visit Kings Park and explore its delightful Botanic Gardens on the broad expanse of the Swan River. In the afternoon, a transfer will take you to Perth International Airport for your flight home.

Sources: https://www.kuoni.co.uk and https://www.australia.com

fields.name: Arrive in Los Angeles
fields.description: On arrival at Los Angeles International Airport, a transfer will take you to your hotel. Here you will meet your fellow travellers and enjoy a Welcome Meal.

fields.name: City Attractions & Theatre Performance
fields.description: Discover the Richard Riordan Central Library, Cathedral of Our Lady of the Angels, Los Angeles Theatre and Olvera Street Markets where vendors are selling everything from Mexican food to leather goods and artwork. In the evening, catch a show at the historic Warner Grand Theatre.

fields.name: Universal Studios
fields.description: Spend the day at Universal Studios Hollywood, the only authentic, working movie studio and theme park in the world. Experience the Wizarding World of Harry Potter, Jurassic World - The Ride, Fast & Furious - Supercharged, Springfield - The Simpsons Ride, Despicable Me Minion Mayhem, Transformers: The Ride–3D, Studio Tour and Halloween Horror Nights.

fields.name: Hollywood Walk of Fame & Griffith Observatory
fields.description: Visit the world-famous Hollywood Walk of Fame which features more than 2,500 terrazzo and brass stars to honour the accomplishments of actors, musicians, directors, producers and others in the entertainment industry. Continue on to the Griffith Observatory where you can take in the spectacular views from the Pacific Ocean to Downtown Los Angeles and come dusk, state-of-the-art telescopes on the lawns offer spectacular views of the solar system.

fields.name: Santa Monica
fields.description: Spend the day at Santa Monica and where you can for a ride on the city's iconic red and yellow Ferris wheel and visit the amusement park. There are also plenty of restaurants, bars, and souvenir shops, as well as an entertaining arcade with more than 200 games. If you stick around past sunset and you might just catch live local music to the sound of the nearby waves.

fields.name: Museums & Botanical Gardens
fields.description: Explore the Museum of Contemporary Art, California Science Center and Natural History Museum of Los Angeles County. In the afternoon, go for a stroll in the Mildred E. Mathias Botanical Gardens. Over 3,000 types of plants grow in the gardens and a wide range of environments are found within their borders, from the dry desert and Mediterranean sections on the eastern end to the shaded, lush interior.

fields.name: Ronald Reagan Presidential Library & Museum and Angel’s Gate Park
fields.description:
