Visit the Ronald Reagan Presidential Library & Museum and Angel’s Gate Park where you can see the Korean Bell of Friendship which was a gift from the Republic of Korea in honour of the U.S. Bicentennial. The massive bell is a symbol of good relations between the two countries. In the evening, a transfer will take you to Los Angeles International Airport for your flight home.

Source: https://www.discoverlosangeles.com

fields.name: Paris-Vincennes Racecourse & Paris Zoo
fields.description: Take a tour of the Paris-Vincennes racecourse which plays host to the majority of big French races and international horse events, like the Grand Prix d’Amérique. Visit Paris Zoo and see the nearly 1000 animals from five natural habitats or ‘biozones’: Patagonia, Africa, Europe, Guyana and Madagascar.

fields.name: Cruise on the Seine
fields.description:
Spend the morning cruising along the Seine riverbanks aboard one of the boats and marvel at the city’s finest monuments, including Notre-Dame, the Conciergerie, the Grand Palais and the Eiffel Tower. In the afternoon, a transfer will take you to Paris Charles de Gaulle International Airport for your flight home.

Source: https://en.parisinfo.com/

fields.name: Arrive in Singapore
fields.description: On arrival at Singapore Changi Airport, a transfer will take you to your hotel. Here you will meet your fellow travellers and enjoy a Welcome Meal.

fields.name: Attractions & Singapore Flyer
fields.description: Explore the Old Parliament House, National Gallery Singapore, Esplanade and Merlion Park where you can catch a glimpse of Singapore’s most majestic icon, the Merlion, a mythical creature that’s half-fish and half-lion. Take a ride on the Singapore Flyer, Asia’s largest observation wheel, and take in the stunning panoramic views of Marina Bay and th­e city.

fields.name: Science Centre & Gardens by the Bay
fields.description: Visit the Science Centre where you can discover the 20 permanent exhibitions and have a go at fun activities such as trek to the centre of the earth to discover the different layers that lay beneath or power an engine using the heat from the palm of your hand. In the afternoon, visit the Gardens by the Bay and take in the amazing views of the city from the 22-metre-high aerial walkway that links two Supertrees together.

fields.name: Universal Studios & Marina Bay Light Show
fields.description: Discover Universal Studios Singapore, the first Hollywood movie theme park in Southeast Asia, which features seven movie-themed zones—Madagascar, Hollywood, Far Far Away (Shrek), The Lost World, Ancient Egypt (The Mummy), Sci-Fi City (Transformers) and New York (Sesame Street). In the evening, visit Marina Bay for a stunning light show that takes place on the water.

fields.name: Botanic Gardens
fields.description:
Spend the day at the Botanic Gardens, a UNESCO World Heritage Site which features highlights such as the National Orchid Garden, a gorgeous swan lake and heaps of tropical trees to please every plant enthusiast out there. In the evening, you will have a farewell meal at one of the best restaurants in Singapore and a transfer will take you to Singapore Changi Airport for your flight home. 

Source: https://www.visitsingapore.com

fields.name: Arrive in Adelaide
fields.description: On arrival at Adelaide International Airport, a transfer will take you to your hotel. Here you will meet your fellow travellers and enjoy a Welcome Meal.

fields.name: Adelaide
fields.description: Explore the South Australian Museum, Art Gallery of South Australia, Jamfactory and the National Railway Museum, Australia’s largest undercover railway museum, where you can find over 100 exhibits and learn about the history of railways in Australia. There will also be the opportunity to discover the Adelaide Botanic Garden, with its majestic tree-lined avenues, Australian native gardens, striking glasshouse conservatory, and Art Deco palm house.

fields.name: Hahndorf and Wine Tasting
fields.description: Discover the picturesque village of Hahndorf, Australia’s oldest surviving German settlement. Wander down its tree-lined streets and take time to explore the quaint shops and taste some of the town’s artisan produce. Continue to the Jacob’s Creek vineyard where you will be able to learn about and sample some of Australia's best wines.

fields.name: Quorn & Wilpena Pound
fields.description: Travel through the Flinders Ranges to Quorn and explore the town’s quirky heritage buildings, or ride a stream train on the Pichi Richi Railway, for stunning views of the outback. Continue on to Wilpena Pound where you'll take a tour, with a local guide, of the faithfully-restored Hills Homestead and Wangarra Lookout, which affords panoramic views over Wilpena Pound.

fields.name: Woomera & Coober Pedy
fields.description: Visit a former rocket-testing site at Woomera before travelling through salt-lake country to isolated Coober Pedy, regarded by many as the opal capital of the world. View an opal demonstration with a local expert, who’ll then lead you through some of the town’s iconic underground buildings.

fields.name: Kangaroo Island
fields.description: Take a ferry to Kangaroo Island, where you'll discover the spectacular Remarkable Rocks and Admirals Arch and experience the only ‘in-flight’ birds of prey display in South Australia, where you’ll see an array of birds including the majestic Wedge- tailed Eagle. There will also be the opportunity to join a ranger at Seal Bay Conservation Park for a guided walk among a colony of rare sea lions in one of the country’s most important breeding colonies.

fields.name: Barossa Valley
fields.description: Spend the day exploring the Barossa Valley which is home to some of the world's best wines as well as superb gourmet food. You can taste the wine and eat local, seasonal produce at more than 80 cellar doors. There will also be the opportunity to visit St Hugo for the Chef’s Table experience. Guided by a St Hugo Chef, you'll prepare lunch and develop your kitchen skills before feasting on your culinary efforts alongside a selection of St Hugo wines.

fields.name: Morialta Conservation Park
fields.description:
Explore Morialta Conservation Park where you can see the rugged ridges, misty waterfalls, quiet woodlands. In the evening, you will have a farewell meal at one of the best restaurants in Adelaide and a transfer will take you to a transfer will take you back to Adelaide International Airport for your flight home.

Sources: https://www.australia.com and https://www.kuoni.co.uk

fields.name: Arrive in Milan
fields.description: On arrival at Milan Malpensa Airport, a transfer will take you to your hotel. Here you will meet your fellow travellers and enjoy a Welcome Meal.

fields.name: Attractions and Navigli Canal
fields.description: Explore the Duomo Cathedral, Castello Sforzesco, Galleria Vittorio Emanuele II and Santa Maria Delle Grazie which hosts one of the greatest masterpieces of Italian art: Leonardo da Vinci’s Last Supper.  In the afternoon, take a stroll down the banks of the Navigli Canal and discover the music venues, restaurants, pubs, traditional hostelries, plus, vintage markets and antique fairs.

fields.name: San Siro Stadium and Fashion District
fields.description: Take a tour of AC Milan's home at San Siro Stadium and visit the Museum to view the club's memorabilia and learn about its history. Spend the afternoon doing some shopping in the Fashion District which includes traditional boutiques, retail chains and designer labels that have made la moda and Made in Italy style famous worldwide.

fields.name: Museums and Theatre Performance
fields.description: Discover the Brera Art Gallery, Cathedral Museum, the Leonardo da Vinci National Museum of Science and Technology and the Ulrico Hoepli Civic Planetarium, Italy's largest planetarium. In the evening, catch a live performance at the world famous Teatro La Scala, which has hosted many of the operas singers, performers, conductors, dancers and directors who have made history including Bellini, Verdi, Maria Callas, Pavarotti, Carla Fracci and Luchino Visconti.

fields.name: Villa Litta Park
fields.description:
Visit Villa Litta Park and explore the gardens of the famous aristocratic Villa that in the nineteenth century became one of the most popular centres of literature and culture. In the afternoon, a transfer will take you to Milan Malpensa Airport for your flight home.

Source: https://www.yesmilano.it/en/

fields.name: Canadian Rockies
fields.description: Alberta's most famous national parks – Banff and Jasper – are Western Canada just as you have imagined it. There are those epic mountain views, glistening melt-water lakes in the shadow of serrated peaks, and the roaming wildlife species which call these rugged landscapes home. Go skiing at the Lake Louise ski resort which offers breathtaking views, long runs, and lots of terrain for all ability levels. Visit the nearby town of Banff which is lined with restaurants, bars, and shops, as well as a vibrant range of art galleries and museums. You'll stay at the Fairmont Chateau hotel which is nestled deep within Banff National Park and has spectacular views of the mountain and village.

fields.name: Lagos
fields.description: Lagos is a large town that sits close to the Algarve’s far western edge. Full of authentic Portuguese charm, its walled Old Town and oceanfront views make it a marvel of a beach resort. Explore the local lighthouse, churches and castle or take it easy at the marina. You'll stay at the Iberostar Selection Hotel in Lagos which is a great choice for couples and friends. Soak up the rays by one of the inviting pools and admire views across the bright-blue Adriatic Sea. Savour delicious dishes at the à la carte restaurant before sipping a cocktail at the lobby bar and don’t forget to do some unwinding at the soothing spa. You’re just a short walk away from the sandy Meia Praia beach and Lagos Marina is nearby too. This property is hard to beat!

fields.name: Toronto
fields.description: Toronto, with its sprawling metropolis, is the third largest English-speaking theatre district in the world, behind New York and London. One of the world's most ethnically diverse cities, it is home to more than 80 ethnic communities from Africa, Asia, and Europe. Shopping is a must here, as Toronto boasts some of the biggest shopping malls in Canada and it is with no surprise that Toronto is also the business centre of Canada. Visit the CN Tower, Royal Ontario Museum and Art Gallery of Ontario. Spend an evening watching a game from one of Toronto's many professional sports teams. Head south to Niagra Falls and experience the breathtaking views of this great natural wonder up-close on a cruise to the base of the falls and sample some of Canada's best food and wine in Niagara-on-the-Lake.

fields.name: North Island
fields.description: Head to the top half of New Zealand and enjoy some of the world’s most diverse scenery. Vineyards, rolling hills, dense rainforests, wild coastlines and glorious white beaches are just some of New Zealand’s superb North Island landscapes, not to mention boiling mud pools and gushing geysers. Be sure to visit its two main port cities, Auckland - the 'City of Sails', and Wellington, its capital, as well as the beautifully unique Art Deco-style Napier and award-winning Hawke’s Bay wine region. Explore the Coromandel Peninsula which includes the famous Cathedral Cove which is featured in multiple Hollywood films. At Rotorua you'll find the geothermal wonderland with bubbling sulphur pools and erupting geysers at Wai-O-Tapu. You can also experience the Māori culture, hospitality and food in Rotorua and try a hangi feast cooked in the steaming ground or take a tour of an authentic pre-European village.

fields.name: New South Wales
fields.description: An abundance of Australian sights and activities, this beautiful region combines iconic man-made icons with dramatic misty mountain ranges and renowned coastal drives. An enchanting combination of fascinating history and natural splendour, New South Wales is Australia at its most vibrant and accessible. One of the country’s smaller states, it nevertheless offers an abundance of enchanting landscapes from glorious beaches to rugged mountains, nature-rich national parks to world-class vineyards, as well as an exhilarating range of things to do and see. In Sydney’s vibrant city centre you’ll find Circular Quay, home of the famous harbour, Royal Botanic Gardens and Opera House on the harbour at Bennelong Point. To the south, you'll find the world famous Bondi Beach with its fine sand and curling waves. Explore the unique rock formations in the World Heritage listed Blue Mountains and discover the Hunter Valley, sampling some of Australia's best wines.

fields.name: Singapore
fields.description: Singapore is a multicultural garden city where 21st-Century skyscrapers sit side by side with a rich colonial past. Extravagant, wealthy and packed full of contrasts, this is a city-state with an infectious energy, renowned for its sensational shopping malls, street markets and mouth-watering cuisine. Home to the cheapest Michelin-starred meal in the world and a space-age botanic garden where towering super trees epitomise the modern vision of the city, its riverside setting and beautiful green spaces only add to the charm. Abundant with history and incredible architecture, Singapore is a cosmopolitan outdoor dream - from its sky-rise greenery to the iconic treetop walkways, what once was a high-rise concrete jungle has today transformed itself into one of Asia's greenest cities.

fields.name: Miami
fields.description: Candy coloured loungers and swish private cabanas line the white sands of Miami Beach. There’s Champagne on tap, pool boys delivering cocktails and Art Deco architecture thrown into the mix. Wear sneakers and play beach volleyball by day but expect to get dressed up to the nines come dusk for access to Miami’s exclusive clubs. If you’ve ever wanted to try SoulCycle, this is the place to do it, but if you’re more inclined to sink into an oversized sofa with a glass of wine watching a pastel pink Miami sunset, that’s just fine here too. The throngs of crowds on South Beach are there for good reason – this is Miami’s most popular spot; but there are also shiny new kids in town. Follow the scent of sun tan lotion to Mid Beach and you’ll find couture cafés, industrial style restaurants and artisanal bakeries. You'll stay at Eden Roc located in Miami Beach where you’ll really get to soak up the Miami lifestyle. Enjoy waking up in your elegant room and looking out to the ocean or city. Then spend the day around one of three stunning pools or nip off to the spa.

fields.name: New York
fields.description: Take a trip to New York and you’ll see why it’s nicknamed ‘the city that never sleeps’. It’s a buzzing, multicultural metropolis where you’ll find some of the world’s most iconic landmarks, endless shopping possibilities and the most diverse dining imaginable. Hop on the Circle Line ferry and visit the Statue of Liberty, a beacon of hope that has welcomed countless immigrants into the USA and one of the world’s most recognisable landmarks. The Museum of the City of New York is a great way to explore this amazing city in even more detail. Head to the Empire State Building, the tallest building in New York, and its 86th-floor observation deck for outstanding views across the city. Times Square is hailed as ‘The Crossroads of the World’ and is a key symbol of brilliantly hectic New York. For a slower pace of life, explore Central Park, its gardens, lakes and zoo or enjoy a carriage ride along its paths. Watch a show on Broadway where you can enjoy anything from musicals and Disney films to comedies or dramas.

fields.name: Vancouver
fields.description: Canada isn’t short of epic natural landscapes and these aren’t confined to the wilderness. The city of Vancouver is framed by the peaks of the North Shore Mountains that sit to the north and backed by the waters of the Strait of Georgia to the west. Visit Science World, Vancouver Art Gallery and Vancouver Aquarium. Explore Vancouver's stylish neighbourhoods, soak up the low-key culture and enjoy some of the best cuisine available in Canada. Go on a tour of the Fraser Valley wine region and enjoy private tastings of some of Canada's best wines. Head to Grouse Mountain and experience winter sports such as skiing, snowboarding, snowshoeing and more.

fields.name: Dublin
fields.description: The charm of the Irish and a slice of ‘the Craic’, is part of what makes a Dublin city break special. The unique hospitality of its locals, combined with a dynamic energy and rich culture create a city of abundant charm. Discover the endless delights of Dublin. Visit the historic Trinity College and the ancient Book of Kells, walking in the footsteps of the literary greats. Discover the Irish Emigration Museum and the Little Museum of Dublin and learn about the country's history. Tour the Guinness Storehouse and sip a pint of the black stuff at the Gravity Bar. Go for a bike ride through Phoenix Park, one of Europe’s largest enclosed city parks, where you can see the deer and explore the gardens. Spend an evening at the Brazen Head and enjoy the live traditional music, great food and company.

fields.name: Montréal
fields.description: Named for the hill Mount Royal which sits at the heart of the city, Montréal, is a mix of French and Anglo influences, feeling at times more European than North American. Thought by many to be Canada’s cultural capital, the city plays host to an array of festivals, sporting events, museums and galleries. Visit the Heritage Gallery, Montréal Aviation Museum and the Écomusée du fier monde. Explore Old Montreal and take in performances of the many street artists and musicians. Go for a hike up Mount Royal and take part in some of the many recreational activities on offer including cycling, boating, skating, skiing, and tobogganing.

fields.name: Antalya
fields.description: Antalya’s beaches are some of the best in Turkey, so get ready to sprawl out on the sands ahead of sensational views. Tuck into Turkish breakfasts, get your fill of golf, and enjoy the wild waterparks. You'll stay at Side Royal Palace Hotel, a bright and modern hotel which gives a nod to the traditional Turkish style throughout its décor. Perfect for couples or families, the hotel is situated a short distance from the beach and the hotel’s private beach area, so you’re in a great location to get your fill of sand and sea. At the hotel you’ll find colourful rooms, dining options and there’s a fun pool area equipped with waterslides.

fields.name: Madrid
fields.description: Madrid is famous for its rich history and diverse culture, and with a wide range of attractions and activities there is something for everyone. Indulge in some shopping on Gran Vía which is lined with traditional boutiques, retail chains and international brands. Take in iconic sights like the Almudena Cathedral, the Teatro Real and the Royal Palace. Go on a tour of Real Madrid's home at Santiago Bernabéu Stadium and learn about the history of the club. Immerse yourself in Madrid’s buzzing social scene and join the locals as they order a late night supper after an evening of lively conversation, nibbling on tapas.

fields.name: Hawaii
fields.description: Dive into the deep blue of the Pacific Ocean, sink into multi-coloured sands and glide over towering sea cliffs on a holiday to Hawaii. Imagine ocean views from barefoot beach shacks, sunset mai tais bejewelled with purple orchids and snorkelling through a whirlwind of tropical fish. With over 400 beaches and 800 miles of stunning coastline, you’re spoilt for choice. Follow crater trails and serpentine jungle hills through lush greenery and waterfalls or, surrounded by the scent of yellow hibiscus and pikake blossom, float your cares away in the pool of a pink palace resort or out on the ocean amongst a dazzling world of marine life. Try paddleboard yoga for the first time, join beach-lined crowds to watch world-class surf competitions or catch the Great North Pacific humpback whales on their annual migration to Hawaiian waters. You'll stay at the Hilton Hawaiian Village located in Honolulu which has a white sand beach surrounded by acres of tropical grounds, with water sports galore and five different pools to cool off in.

fields.name: Western Australia
fields.description: Vast and diverse, far away from the East Coast crowds, Australia’s largest state holds the key to a glorious adventure. Laid-back and yet packed full with options for dining, shopping and entertainment, Perth has the best of both worlds. Wander through the treetops at the Botanic Garden on the Lotterywest Federation Walkway, or discover the Perth Institute of Contemporary Arts and the Perth Mint. There are over 20 well-maintained beaches within easy reach of Perth, and some lovely beachside suburbs. 11 miles offshore from Perth, Rottnest Island – affectionately known as ‘Rotto’ – is Western Australia’s island getaway. This is a protected A-Class Reserve where you can cycle, walk and snorkel, and of course visit the adorably chubby-cheeked marsupials that live there – quokkas. There is also plenty to explore in the vast Kimberley region which is home to grand mountain ranges, gorges and waterfalls.

fields.name: Northern Territory
fields.description: This is the land of ‘Dreamtime’, the part of Australia most in touch with its Aboriginal culture. The Northern Territory has waterfall-filled national parks and ancient art etched into rocks, and in the Outback, you’ll find pockets of time where there’s nothing but you and the rugged dirt landscapes – perfect for an exhilarating road trip. Darwin is the gateway to the the Red Centre and known for its sunsets and markets, and maintains a frontier aura, with the bush clamouring at the city limits. In Nitmiluk National Park, the 13 gorges of the Katherine River are a stunning sight for both day trippers and the resident crocodile. Explore Uluru-Kata Tjuta National Park where you can stay within sight of the great sandstone monolith for the famous sunset and sunrise views.

fields.name: Tasmania
fields.description: If there's any place on earth that's an untouched Garden of Eden, it's Tasmania's remote, temperate wilderness. With more than 40% of the island protected in reserves and National Parks, this is an island for nature lovers. Separated from mainland Australia by the Bass Strait, the country's smallest state offers a magnificent variety of landscapes, from primeval looking forests and magnificent waterfalls to spectacular coastlines of rugged cliffs and sweeping bays. In Tasmania, the air is fresh and the land untouched, making this island state a fabulous place to drive, walk and to explore. Head to Cradle Mountain for spectacular scenery, hiking and bushwalking trails. At Freycinet National Park you'll find Wineglass Bay and one of the world's most beautiful beaches. Hobart's historic waterfront is the city's main hub - wander around the famous Salamanca Market on a Saturday morning for local arts, crafts and fresh local food.

fields.name: South Island
fields.description: South Island has some of the best scenery New Zealand has to offer, from rolling vineyards and sweeping beaches to sparkling lakes and snow-topped peaks. It’s known for its spectacular scenery, but there’s more to New Zealand’s South Island than just mountains and waterways. Queenstown is a popular lakeside and alpine ski town with storybook scenery and plenty of opportunities for an adrenaline rush. There's bungy jumping, skiing, snowboarding, skydiving, jet-boating and more. Enjoy world-class wine, superb walking trails and an incredibly diverse range of wildlife all in one place. Go on a heli-hike on Franz Josef Glaicer which includes a 10 minute helicopter flight to the top of the glacier where you can take in the epic views. On your way back to Auckland, stop off at Hobbiton and discover the world famous movie set.

fields.name: Victoria
fields.description: In this much-loved state, spot native wildlife from penguins to wombats, chill out at beachside suburbs and indulge in wine tasting. In Melbourne, take in the sights of the historic Queen Victoria Market, admire the modern architecture in Federation Square, and for retail therapy enter Bourke Street Mall or stroll down Little Collins Street. Explore the Grampians National Park and sample some of Australia's best wines in the Yarra Valley. Head east along Australia's most famous drive, the Great Ocean Road, and discover the limestone rock formations rising majestically out of deep blue-green waters far below, moulded by the unwavering power of the waves. At Phillip Island you can watch the Penguin Parade, where little fairy penguins waddle up the beach each evening to their sand burrows.

fields.name: Queensland
fields.description: In laid-back Queensland, sparkling coral waters dotted with picture-perfect islands combine with city-lined beachscapes and a thriving bar and café culture. From stretches of secluded sand backed by national parks to popular surfing spots just metres from a city’s skyline, Queensland is home to some of the most varied beachscapes in Australia. Queensland's capital, Brisbane, offers sophisticated galleries, rooftop bars and a vibrant inner-city beach and lagoon. A little further afield, the Gold Coast is an adventurous playground, with its theme parks, sandy beaches and popular surfing spots just metres from high-rise apartment blocks. Fraser Island is popular - not least due to the amazing beaches, forests and lakes only accessible by 4x4 vehicles. There's plenty to do in and around Cairns with opportunities for snorkelling, scuba diving and exploring the underwater world of the Great Barrier Reef.

fields.name: South Australia
fields.description: With its rolling emerald hills and valleys dotted with historic churches and charming cellar doors, Adelaide and its stunning wine regions offer a peaceful escape and the chance to indulge in a rich epicurean culture flavoured by the best of Australian food and wine. In Adelaide, explore the South Australian Museum, Art Gallery of South Australia, Jamfactory and the National Railway Museum. Festivals, like the huge Adelaide Fringe which takes place in February and March, are easy to find. The countryside is just on your doorstep in the Adelaide Hills, where you can visit German-influenced towns and wineries. Some of the world's oldest grapevines are found in the South Australia Wine Regions which include the famed Barossa Valley. Wildlife is easy to find in South Australia – Kangaroo Island is Australia's very own Galapagos with incredible wildlife viewing 45 minutes from the mainland.

fields.name: Whistler
fields.description: Probably the most famous of Canada’s mountain resorts is beautiful Whistler, which played host to the 2010 Winter Olympics. Outdoor enthusiasts flock here from around the world to enjoy the many activities on offer. This truly is a year-round resort with skiing, snowboarding and snowmobiling popular in the winter, and hiking, mountain climbing, canoeing and zip-lining drawing visitors in the summer. A ride on the Peak 2 Peak Gondola, which links Whistler to Blackcomb and offers 360-degree views of the breathtaking scenery, is a must. You'll stay at the Fairmont Chateau hotel which is located at the bottom of Blackcomb Mountain and has spectacular views of the  mountain and village.

fields.name: Los Angeles
fields.description: There’s laid-back SoCal beach life vibes and the summer scent of palm-lined sidewalks as you pass clean-living LA natives’ rollerblading, jogging and flexing their muscles at oceanfront outdoor gyms. Amongst an ever-accelerating pace, Lycra and yoga mats sit alongside high heels and oversized sunglasses on Los Angeles holidays - there’s always coffee-on-the-go, Hollywood movie references on every corner and elaborate fashion stores lining Rodeo Drive and Melrose Avenue. Visit the Richard Riordan Central Library, Cathedral of Our Lady of the Angels, Museum of Contemporary Art, California Science Center and Natural History Museum. Take a tour of Universal Studios where thrilling 3D rides and backstage film sets come to life. Discover the Walk of Fame celebrity handprints and an altogether different kind of stargazing at the Griffith Observatory, where, come dusk, state-of-the-art telescopes on the lawns offer spectacular views of the solar system.

fields.name: San Francisco
fields.description: San Francisco is a little odd – but let’s face it, that’s all part of its charm. It’s got the twistiest street in the world, its own resident sea lion colony and a former prison flocked by tourists. Cross the famous Golden Gate Bridge and take in the epic views of San Francisco Bay and the city’s skylines. Head down to the seafront for a stroll on the popular Fisherman’s Wharf where you can buy crab chowder to go and watch the sea lions that have taken up residence on its docks. Take a ferry to the rock and explore Alcatraz, where some of the United States’ most notorious criminals were incarcerated. Visit the busy and bustling Union square for some retail therapy. You'll find everything from international brands to boutiques, spas and restaurants housed in beautifully restored Victorian buildings.

fields.name: Chicago
fields.description: Located on the shores of Lake Michigan, Chicago is known as the ‘Windy City’ and has an instantly recognisable skyline of spectacular skyscrapers. With a great combination of city attractions - stunning modern and traditional architecture, beautiful green parks, a renowned Blues and Jazz scene and fantastic shopping - it is a truly wonderful city to visit, particularly in the summer months. Visit the the Bean, Chicago Design Museum, the Museum of Contemporary Photography and the Chicago Sport Museum. Take a tour of Goose Island brewery where you'll be able to see how the beer is made and enjoy a pint. Go for a stroll on the Lakefront Trail where you can take in the magnificent views of Chicago's skyline and harbour. Enjoy some retail therapy at Wicker Park and Logan Square where you can find boutiques, thrift shops, and flagship stores. Watch a show at the Shakespeare Theatre where you can enjoy anything from musicals and Disney films to comedies or dramas.

fields.name: Paris
fields.description: The world’s style capital, Paris is the ultimate continental and classy city. In short, it’s a buzzing metropolis of iconic structures. Dig a little deeper, and it’s a place of great romance which features arty antique fairs and gourmet restaurants that all add to the unforgettable atmosphere. You'll stay at the Elysees Union Hotel which is a wonderful hotel offering an exceptional location in the heart of Paris. Set in a 19th century building, this elegant hotel features an interior garden and is located only a short walk from the one of the most beautiful avenues in the world, the Champs-Elysées. The Arc de Triomphe is also close by as well as many other historic attractions. Guestrooms have been designed with a classic style in mind, making this property a great choice for those on a budget searching for traditional Parisian hospitality.

fields.name: Milan
fields.description: A fashion-lover's paradise, stylish Milan is modern and vibrant, yet still manages to keep its past alive with a well-maintained historic complex and some impressive, newer architecture. Milan is the perfect combination of sophisticated living and captivating exploring. Visit the Brera Art Gallery, Cathedral Museum and the Leonardo da Vinci National Museum of Science and Technology. Take a tour of AC Milan's home at San Siro Stadium and visit the Museum to view the club's memorabilia and learn about its history.  Watch a performance at Teatro La Scala, the 18th-Century temple of opera, has hosted the world's most prestigious performers. Explore the famous Duomo Cathedral and its surrounding piazza, cafés, restaurants and boutiques.

fields.name: Zermatt
fields.description:
Amazing scenery, a huge 360km of skiing and a beautiful resort centre - Zermatt has everything. With the iconic Matterhorn as your backdrop you can start the day in Switzerland, ski in Italy and lunch on authentic Italian food in Cervinia and be back in time for dinner in this stunning resort. Its world-class ski area is known for the high-altitude and advanced skiing, but it also has beginner areas closer to the town. The resort centre is bustling in the evenings with buzzing nightlife and a range of fantastic restaurants to try out. You’ll find a great après environment with plenty of bars to suit any budget. There are over 100 restaurants, from fancy bistros to typically Swiss specialities. If you’re looking for even more adventure, you can even try heli-skiing. And there are plenty of other activities, like snowshoeing and ice skating. You'll stay at the Hotel Monte Rosa, a historic alpine hotel located in the very heart of Zermatt, in close proximity to the shops and bars.

https://www.matterhornparadise.ch/en/
https://www.tui.co.uk/destinations/europe/switzerland/zermatt/holidays-zermatt.html
https://www.crystalski.co.uk/ski-resorts/switzerland-ski-holidays/zermatt/

fields.name: Fethiye
fields.description: Popular Fethiye is a town with plenty to talk about. Stretching along the coast with a treasure trove of fabulous views, historical old centres and a shining marina, this south-western favourite has so much to spoil you. Trek into the hills, party into the night, and dig into the yummiest seafood around. You'll stay at Letoonia Hotel which is located on a beautiful private peninsula amongst a green pine forest and offers fantastic panoramic views over the Aegean Sea and the fishing port of Fethiye. The resort has a village feel throughout and has a lively centre where the entertainment takes place each day. With three small private sand and shingle beaches, an array of wonderful bars and restaurants, a great range of activities and various accommodation options spread throughout the grounds and the main hotel building, there’s something to keep all the family happy here.

fields.name: Lefkas
fields.description: Think you know the Greek islands? Think again. This under-the-radar isle is ready to wow with its winning combo of postcard good looks and go-slow vibes. And dreamy doesn’t even begin to cover it. We’re talking barely-touched beaches, wild olive groves and sparkling blue-green waters as far as the eye can see. This is the real-deal Greece we all want to see. You'll stay at Christina Studios and Apartments which offers a peaceful pool area, spacious accommodation and al fresco breakfasts at the pool bar and are typically Greek in style. The outdoor pool and accompanying terrace is a real sun trap, with a smaller children’s section for the little ones too. These apartments are ideal for families or couples seeking a chilled break on Lefkas.

fields.name: Mýkonos
fields.description: Welcome to the ultimate in Greek chic – an island so stylish it's the stuff of legends. Beach club brunches, swanky lunches and sunset cocktails mean Mykonos is always ready to revel in the good life. But it does low-key too, with candlelit seafood suppers, local adventures and history hunting also on the menu. Whitewashed Mykonos Town takes centre stage in this glam-as-you-like Grecian gem, but you’ll find plenty of dinky little villages oozing tradition and authentic tavernas if you know where to look. As for the beaches, do as the jet set do and party on Paradise Beach or soak up the sun on the north coast’s quieter coves. You'll stay at My Mykonos Hotel which is perfect if you are looking to experience the essence of Mykonos. Located just outside Mykonos Town you can laze by the pool observing the beautiful sea views. My Mykonos Hotel perfectly blends minimal design and comfort to bring you the ultimate relaxing experience.

fields.name: Zante
fields.description: Just off the south-west tip of mainland Greece, Zante is a glimmering Ionian jewel, where families come to relax, clubbers come to dance and sea turtles come to nest. Coves of curving azure water and sun-speckled sand are where you'll want to spend all your days. You'll stay at the Admiral Hotel which is perfect for those looking for accommodation just moments away from Argassi resort centre with its shops, bars and restaurants and a short bus ride from Zante Town, which features quaint streets and a vibrant harbour area. The hotel is ideal for families with stacks of entertainment on offer and apartments that sleep up to 4. The hotel is set in a pretty location with views over to Zante town and the Mediterranean Sea, with well-maintained lawns for sunbathing.

fields.name: Marbella
fields.description: It’s no wonder holidays to Marbella are a favourite with families and sun-worshippers alike with its 24 beaches and oodles of culture. Whether you’re here for the soft sands and good times at resorts such as Nikki Beach, the history of Marbella Old Town or the glitz and glam of Puerto Banus, there’s plenty to explore. You'll stay at Marbella Playa which is ideally located directly on the beach and has a charming layout like an Andalusian village so it’s easy to totally relax and switch off. There are plenty of facilities on offer including a swimming pool overlooking the beach, which is the perfect place to unwind. This is a great option for families, couples or friends looking for a relaxing beach holiday on the outskirts of Marbella.

fields.name: Lanzarote
fields.description: A favourite of the Canary Islands and one of Spain’s most-loved destinations, Lanzarote is a fantastic place for a break in the sun, whatever the time of year. Whether you want to chill on the shores of the Atlantic, explore volcanic landscapes or climb the magnificent Mountains of Fire, Lanzarote caters to all. You'll stay at Ficus Apartments which offers a relaxing stay in a peaceful part of Costa Teguise. Spend your days by the pool, making the most of the sunshine, or enjoying the All Inclusive meals served at the buffet restaurant. The low-rise, whitewashed buildings sit among the dramatic volcanic landscape that Lanzarote is famous for. Look forward to the daily entertainment programme and, for a great alternative to the pool, you can easily journey to the nearby coastline of Costa Teguise and admire the shimmering oceanfront.

fields.name: Tenerife
fields.description: Tenerife is an island of volcanic sandy beaches, with the mighty Mount Teide waiting to wow and playful resorts like Playa de las Americas that are built for fun. You’ve got it – Tenerife holidays are a big hit with a list of traits to top them all. Welcome to a dazzling destination with magic in its veins. You'll stay at Sol Tenerife which offers bags of fun for couples and friends, so if you’re on the lookout for a Tenerife hotel that nails great value and is close to all the nightlife, call off the search. Make the most of the direct beach access, three outdoor pools, lively daily entertainment and a selection of sports activities. There’s a range of board options, too! As for the evenings, you’ll be in the heart of all the action, with the bar-lined strip just next door.

fields.name: Praia Da Luz
fields.description: The white sands of Praia Da Luz feel like an open invitation to relax. But if you ever fancy getting active on your Praia Da Luz holiday, there’s a top tennis academy here as well. Explore wowing Roman ruins inland or visit Lagos Zoo nearby where you’ll find all sorts of friendly animals. You'll stay at the Vilamar Resort which offers spacious, well-equipped apartments and villas that are bright and modern in style. The resort centre is just a short walk away, meaning this is a perfect base to explore and experience all of the wonders the Algarve has to offer! A charming pool area, fun-filled kids club and attentive service round off the reasons why you should book the Vilamar Resort for your next holiday!

fields.name: Stalos
fields.description: Embrace low-key life in Stalos. Set yourself up for a holiday away from the hustle and bustle of livelier resorts, with endlessly stunning seaside scenery to boot. Stalos is wall-to-wall classic white exteriors, where a sprinkling of shops and cafés also adds to the mix. You'll stay at the Creta Palm Hotel, a modern property with a friendly and welcoming atmosphere located close to the beach. There’s a wide variety of bars and restaurants just a stones’ throw from the hotel and thanks to a bus stop nearby, exploring the local area is made easy. Feel at home in the cosy and well-presented studios and apartments and there’s a couples of pools too, each with their own pool bar in the complex.

fields.name: Cancun
fields.description: Welcome to Cancun, a city recognised throughout the world for its spectacular white sand beaches and its fascinating sea in turquoise blue tones. Whether you’re here for the markets, local cantinas, and shows, the bars and nightclubs that give fame to Cancun's incomparable nightlife or the exciting and entertaining aquatic experiences, there’s plenty to explore. You'll stay at the Riu Cancun which is a beachside hotel that has a buzz about it. Sports are on tap, drinks are free flowing, and shops, bars, and clubs are all on the doorstep. The hotel is set on a white-sand beach just 15 minutes’ walk from Cancun's nightclubs and bars. There are two shopping malls just footsteps away, too.

fields.name: Praia Da Rocha
fields.description: Leading on from the urban inland town of Portimão, Praia da Rocha is a coastal resort packed with things to see and do. Peer from the top of breathtaking cliffs, stroll by a shimmering marina and splash into the waterpark. A casino and shopping centre are on your doorstep too. You'll stay at Casa Concha which has everything you could want in a Praia Da Rocha holiday rental. You’ll feel at home in this warm and welcoming atmosphere. Take a dip in the large pool to cool down from the heat, then enjoy a meal on your built-in barbecue before grabbing some shade under the covered terraces. You'll stay at the Jupiter Algarve Hotel where you can enjoy a dip in the outdoor pool or stretch out on a lounger.  There’s a super gym and skin-nourishing spa too. Before the evening’s entertainment and live music kicks in, dine in the ambient à la carte restaurant or grab a drink in the lobby bar. You’ll get that holiday feeling alright.

fields.name: Lindos
fields.description: Understandably, the white-hued buildings dotted around this coastal gem have guaranteed Lindos as the prettiest resort of the island. It’s bright and blue, and a place of sheer peace – not to mention its sizzling summer temperature! The Acropolis is a must-see, and you can’t miss the chance to go on a donkey ride. You'll stay at Lambis Studios which offers light and bright Self Catering accommodation that’s a great base for exploring Lindos and beyond. The hotel also boasts a pretty pool scene immersed within flourishing gardens. The apartments and studios come complete with balcony or terrace and a kitchenette too, but if you don’t fancy cooking, there’s the poolside snack bar. Just 500m away is Lindos town. It’s off-the-scale charming with its sugar-cube houses, tucked-away boutiques, and of course the famous Acropolis that stands proud above the town. Not to mention the gorgeous golden beach!

fields.name: Agios Nikolaos
fields.description: After a quiet Greek getaway? Say hello to sleepy Agios Nikolaos, a dinky fishing village that’s part of the stunning Peloponnese peninsula and framed by the lush Taygetos Mountains. Stone buildings in golden hues line the waterfront, offering a smattering of traditional tavernas to dine at. You'll stay at Litsa Apartments which are located just a 350m walk from the beautiful resort centre of Agios Nikolaos. Here you’ll find traditional tavernas, quaint streets and a bustling marina. Wander through this authentic local town and take in all it has to offer. With simple rooms offering all the essentials, this is the perfect base for a sun and culture trip to Greece. If you don’t feel like exploring, the hotel has a small, quiet pool where there are plenty of sun loungers to choose from. Surrounded by greenery, it’s a relaxing, secluded spot.

fields.name: Carvoeiro
fields.description: Once a quiet fishing village, Carvoeiro has grown into a fully-fledged beach resort. Along with a selection of sandy beaches, you’ll find tourist-friendly attractions like a sun-drenched golf course and fun-packed waterpark. By night, explore the buzzing town square where shops and restaurants really thrive with life. You'll stay at the Rocha Brava Village Resort which is situated on a magnificent clifftop, overlooking the Atlantic Ocean, with a great range of facilities. Set within beautifully landscaped gardens, including artificial lakes and colourful trees, this pleasant low rise development provides an excellent base to explore the local area. The selection of pools means you have the choice of a gentle daytime swim or a splash around with the kids. The laid-back Portuguese lifestyle is felt within the surrounding area but there is plenty of opportunities to explore the resort of Carvoeiro with a selection of delicious restaurants or take a boat trip to see the dramatic Algarve coast.

fields.name: Santorini
fields.description: Out-of-this-world sunsets? Tick. Stunning sea views? Tick. Pretty whitewashed towns? Tick! Filled with chic bars, swanky restaurants and swish boutiques, photogenic Santorini will sweep you straight off your feet. There are two different sides to this superb island. Over on the west, iconic villages like Oia, Fira and Imerovigli overlook an enchanting caldera and the twinkling Aegean. While in the east, in resorts like Kamari and Perissa, it’s all about volcanic shores, where black-sand beaches beckon with turquoise waters. You'll stay at Imperial Med Hotel, situated on the secluded beach of Agia Paraskevi, on the outskirts of Kamari resort. The hotel is of traditional Cycladic architecture with a fusion of modern furnishings to give a tranquil atmosphere. If you are looking for a hotel to offer excellent hospitality and a place to create memories, then Imperial Med Hotel is perfect for you.

fields.name: Kos
fields.description: Part of the showstopping Dodecanese Islands, Kos has long been a favourite for sunshine holidays. Here you have the choice of lively party towns, laid-back seaside resorts and traditional fishing villages – all of them boasting beautiful beaches and dishing up heavenly traditional cuisine. Like history? It's got heaps of it. This is an island where centuries-old relics neighbour vibrant bars and buzzy promenades. You'll stay at the Aegean Houses which is located on the outskirts of Kos Town close to a pebble beach. If you want a low-key, peaceful break in Kos this property has all that you will need. The pool area boasts a good sized swimming pool, children’s pool and also a Jacuzzi so there is ample space for relaxing in the Grecian sun. All rooms have a good sized kitchenette, including all the appliances that you will need, or if you are wanting to venture further afield to experience some traditional Greek cuisine, Kos Town is only a short distance away.

fields.name: Alvor
fields.description: Reveal the sophisticated side of the Algarve on an Alvor holiday. Things take a relaxed pace in the old town, where you’ll uncover centuries-old churches and castles sitting alongside classy bars. Marvel at the beauty of the boardwalk that leads you along a lagoon to reach some peaceful sandy beaches. You'll stay at the Luna Alvor Village which offers studios equipped with the home comforts to create a great base for your stay. The vast outdoor space is perfect to allow you to make the most of the gorgeous sunshine and to cool off, step into the large outdoor pool. This property has a calming atmosphere but take a trip into the resort centre if you would like to explore the local area and try some fantastic bars and restaurants. The bright and modern Luna Alvor Village can be the escape you are looking for in your next summer getaway.

fields.name: Albufeira
fields.description: One of the Algarve’s most popular resorts, you'll be spoilt for choice on your Albufeira holiday. Take it easy on the beaches and great golf courses or hit the Strip for electric nights out. Thrill-seekers can check out the waterparks, whilst those wanting something low-key can wander the white-washed Old Town. You'll stay at the Paladim Alagoamar Hotel which offers a relaxing atmosphere and a friendly welcome to the popular, fun-filled resort of Albufeira. Find your spot at the poolside for those lazy days or head on down to the long, sandy beach for some activities to get all ages excited. The location means you can experience both the old town and the new, where a variety of bars and restaurants can be found. The nearby area is perfect for those who love to shop, so make sure some spending money is put aside.

fields.title: Amazing Tour
fields.review: Just had the most amazing 12 day tour of Queensland, some of the best weeks of my life without a doubt! Met some incredible people and made some friends for life. Our tour guide Carolyn was brilliant so knowledgeable about every stop and was a great laugh throughout! Gutted it’s over it went to quick.

fields.title: Highly Recommend
fields.review: Highly recommend the Queensland tour. Had the best time on this trip and met so many lovely people along the way. Really enjoyed all the activities, snorkelling in the Whitsundays being the highlight! Ben was a fab tour guide! Would recommend this trip.

fields.title: Amazing Tour
fields.review:
The South Australia tour was such an amazing experience. I would highly recommend it to anyone. 
My leaders were Alex and Evie and their energy was great and they definitely knew how to have a good time! They have such a passion for what they do it just makes the whole adventure that much better. I couldn't have asked for a better week.

fields.title: Best Trip Ever
fields.review: Currently on the South Australia tour and it has been amazing! Ben has been a great guide with so much knowledge of all the places we’ve been and I've really enjoyed all the activities. I particularly enjoyed the whine tour of the Barossa Valley. If you’re thinking of travelling South Australia I would 100% recommend doing it with Go Explore.

fields.title: Great Trip
fields.review: Had the most amazing time meeting new people while traveling through Victoria. Would recommend to anyone who’s planning to come to Australia. We were lucky enough to have a great tour guide who made the trip unforgettable and made sure we had the best time ever.

fields.title: Wonderful Trip
fields.review: This trip was an amazing experience. There was a great group atmosphere and we saw some of the most beautiful landscapes of the world. I particularly enjoyed the visit to Uluru. Our tour guide Charlotte was just the best guide we could dream to have, she is full of energy and took good care of all of us. I can hardly recommend this trip enough because it’s amazing and I will never forget it!

fields.title: Ultimate Tour
fields.review: The tour is well thought out and organised. You stay at great hotels, have some amazing activities and make some new friendships. Thanks to our lovely tour guide, Charlie, traveling was really easy and not stressful.

fields.title: Trip of a Lifetime
fields.review: Had a great time in Australia on the Victoria tour. Sam was a great leader and helped us enormously and we had so much fun! There were so many great experiences but the best part was the trip along the Great Ocean Road and getting to see the Twelve Apostles. Thank you for the best time!

fields.title: Ultimate Tasmanian Adventure
fields.review: Had the most amazing tour of Tasmania, Sam is a phenomenal tour leader! He makes every single day and night so super fun and made sure we all had the most amazing time, The itinerary is great and well worth with it. The visit to Mt Field National Park was the highlight for me!

fields.title: Best Trip Ever
fields.review: This was one of the best trips of my life, I have too many memories to count. I was lucky to have great tour leaders, Jackson and Sam, they made sure the group was always doing great things and were there to help with whatever we needed. My highlight the trip was the cruise along the Freycinet Peninsula. I would definitely recommend this trip.

fields.title: Best Trip Ever
fields.review: This tour of New South Wales has been amazing. We got to see all the animals at Taronga Zoo, discover the Blue Mountains and see what Australian beaches had to offer. Our tour guide Ben has made the trip specially great, he welcomed us with open arms and is a really funny down to earth guy with lots of knowledge. Would recommend to anyone.

fields.title: Brilliant Tour
fields.review: Currently on the New South Wales tour and it has been amazing! Tom has been a great guide with so much knowledge of all the places we’ve been and I've really enjoyed all the experiences and activities. If you’re thinking of travelling Australia I would totally recommend this tour.

fields.title: An Amazing Experience
fields.review: Everything on this tour of Western Australia was well thought out and organised. You stay at great hotels, take part in some amazing activities and make some new friendships. I particularly enjoyed the trip to Wave Rock. Thanks to our lovely tour guide, Beth, traveling was really easy and not stressful at all.

fields.title: Great Trip
fields.review: It‘s been a great 12 days on this tour of Western Australia. Even if you‘ve high expectations it will be great. Sam is a phenomenal tour leader. He makes every single day and night so super fun and made sure we all had the most amazing time. I really enjoyed all the places we got to visit but the highlight was watching dolphins swim into shore to be fed. Would totally recommend!

fields.title: Excellent Tour
fields.review: We had an excellent time exploring Singapore with our guide Jan. The tour was very informative and professional, and I really enjoyed the Gardens by the Bay where you can see some amazing views. Jan was an excellent guide, happy to answer any questions and was very knowledgable and funny! Would definitely recommend this tour.

fields.title: Best Tour I've Been On
fields.review: This tour of Singapore was honestly the best tour I’ve even experienced. Darren was the best tour guide and gave us so much information. I finished the tour feeling so fulfilled and knowledgable about the city. Please, please whatever you do go on this tour. It’s a must!

fields.title: Amazing Tour
fields.review: I had an amazing time during the tour of New Zealand's North Island. It was lovely to see New Zealand without the stress of arranging everything yourself. Our guide was amazing as well, he knew a lot about the places we went to and lifted the entire trip to the next level. I would definitely recommend this tour to others, since I had an amazing time!

fields.title: Highly Recommend
fields.review: Had the most amazing time meeting new people while traveling the North Island. Would recommend to anyone who’s planning to come to New Zealand. We were lucky enough to have the best tour guide Michael, a long time local, who made the trip unforgettable and made sure we had the best time ever. Highly recommend.

fields.title: Ultimate Tour of New Zealand
fields.review: This was a really fun tour of New Zealand. I have had the most amazing time whilst on this tour. So many memories, amazing experiences and unbelievable friendships made. My favourite part of the tour was the sky diving in Queenstown. Matt was a great leader and he taught us a lot about New Zealand and we had so much fun. I would urge absolutely anyone to come out to New Zealand and experience this tour. You will have the time of your life.

fields.title: Amazing Trip
fields.review: I had the best time on this tour of New Zealand. It has a good mix of guided activities and personal time to explore. The highlight was definitely the helicopter tour of the glacier. Sam was a top guide getting everyone involved and making sure they had a good time. I had an amazing time on this trip and would recommend it to everyone!

fields.title: Another Amazing Stay in Paradise
fields.review: Once again the team at Fairmont delivered, above and beyond the call of duty and made our trip and very special. We stayed here for the weekend for my father’s birthday and left with an amazing feeling and smile on our faces. This is a great resort with the best amenities and service anywhere in world. A truly world class hotel. The staff is what makes this hotel a success and they deserve all the credit. Love you guys and thank you.

fields.title: A True Mountain Experience
fields.review: We've been here 4 or 5 times already and we always like to return. On the foot of blackcomb mountain, the hotel gives a nice setting and view of the mountain. Another one of Fairmonts amazing properties well kept. Service is always impeccable. Its not as busy as it use to be this time of the year which is good to relax. Lots of dining options within the vicinity and the concierge is always very helpful. Relax in Sheer Luxury.

fields.title: Stunning Location and Hotel
fields.review: We had the privilege of visiting Fairmont Chateau Lake Louise in January and were in awe of the beauty of this very upscale hotel. Through great fortune we were able to return and stay in early April for a week of skiing. The views from our room of Lake Louise made every morning and evening incredible. The staff were outstanding and extremely helpful. The food is beyond delicious and unforgettable. Excellent value with great memories. Thank you so very much!

fields.title: Amazing Experience
fields.review: It’s been a while since we’ve stayed at The Chateau. We did winter activities as well as enjoyed plenty of dining experiences. Excellent service from everyone at the hotel from checking in, shuttle services, rentals and dining services. We had a truly relaxing and well fed time. Thank you for an awesome holiday!

fields.title: Amazing Experience
fields.review: We thoroughly enjoyed our tour of Paris. It has a good mix of guided activities and personal time to explore. The highlight was definitely the visit to the Eiffel Tour. Michelle was our guide and she was very and informative. We had an amazing time and were entertained and educated the whole way.

fields.title: Excellent Tour
fields.review: We had an excellent time exploring Paris with our guide Pierre. We got to see all the amazing sights that Paros has to offer. The tour was very informative and Pierre was an excellent guide, happy to answer any questions and was very knowledgable and funny! Would definitely recommend this tour.

fields.title: Amazing Trip
fields.review: We had an amazing time on our tour. We were able to see so many different sights in Dublin, including Trinity College and the Guiness Storehouse, and our tour guide Rory was knowledgeable as well as enjoyable. I would definitely recommend this tour to anyone who wants to see all the main sights of Dublin. We loved our trip and hope to do it again some day!

fields.title: Great Tour
fields.review: This 6 day tour of Dublin was an great experience. Alex as our guide and he told us informative and entertaining stories of Ireland. He went out of his way to make our travels comfortable and engaging. The best! The accommodation was all outstanding - especially unbelievable given the reasonable price of the trip. We enjoyed each day and are thrilled that we chose this five day tour.

fields.title: Fantastic Tour
fields.review: Really enjoyed the tour of Madrid. We got to see the Royal Palace and go shopping on the Gran Vía. Rodrigo was an excellent guide with lots of knowledge and passionate about the city. So many great historical, cultural, & good insights. Would recommend this tour to anyone!

fields.title: Fun and Informative Tour
fields.review: We spent 5 days in Madrid on this tour. Our guide Rodrigo was full of information and passion. He really went the extra mile to make sure that we had a fantastic time and knew all the facts as well as plenty of local knowledge. The highlight for us was the visit to the Royal Palace.

fields.title: Great Way to Discover Montréal
fields.review: This tour was an excellent introduction to Montreal. It made us discover the city and its iconic places in an interesting and fun way, listening to lots of anecdotes and historical facts narrated by our guide. We learned a lot about Montreal's history, architecture, culture and food. Would definitely recommend.

fields.title: Fun and Informative Tour
fields.review: Had a great time in Montréal on this tour. Caroline was a great tour guide who made stories come alive. She was a certified guide, native, and had so much information to share. There were so many great experiences but the best part was getting to see the street performances in Old Montréal. Thank you for the best time!

fields.title: Great Way to See the Sights
fields.review: I've just had the best time on this tour of Toronto. It was a great way to see the sights and learn a little history on a tight timeline with someone else doing the driving. The tour guide was great. We had lots of fun and it was a nice experience with just a small group. Would definitely recommend!

fields.title: Amazing Tour
fields.review: Had the most amazing tour of Toronto, Michael was a phenomenal tour leader! He gave a good amount of history and showed us spots not mentioned on the tour. Great way to see such large city in only 5 days. Would recommend to anyone traveling to Toronto.

fields.title: Best Tour Ever
fields.review: This tour of Vancouver was honestly the best tour I’ve even experienced. Andy was a fantastic tour guide and we thoroughly enjoyed the tour riding in a very comfortable van, learning about the city and seeing all the highlights of Vancouver. Highly recommend this tour, I hope Andy is your guide, he was excellent!

fields.title: Great Tour
fields.review: It‘s was a great 12 days on this tour of Vancouver which gave us a good overview of the city. The tour was very informative and each stop gave you a good amount of time to see the site. Guide was funny and really knew his stuff. Well worth the money!

fields.title: Great Tour and Great Guide
fields.review: This tour of Chicago has been amazing. We got to see the Bean, the Sport Museum and the Shakespeare Theatre. Elliot was our guide and he was very and informative. We had a great time and entertained and educated the whole way. We loved the whole trip.

fields.title: Great Experience
fields.review: We had the best time on this tour of Chicago. It has a good mix of guided activities and personal time to explore. The highlight was definitely the visit to Goose Island Brewery. Sam was a great guide, he was very informative and entertaining. I had an amazing time on this trip and would recommend it to everyone!

fields.title: Best New York Tour
fields.review: We went on this tour of New York in November and we loved it. Everything was well thought out and organised. You stay at great hotels, see all the main sights of New York. Rachel was our tour guide, she was extremely informative and it was a lot of fun to learn about New York. traveling was really easy and not stressful at all. I would definitely recommend going on this tour.

fields.title: Great Tour
fields.review: We had a great 7 days on this tour of New York. Tim was amazing tour guide, he gave us so much information & he was so knowledgable. I really enjoyed all the places we got to visit but visiting the Statue of Liberty was the highlight for us. We would thoroughly recommend this trip.

fields.title: Fantastic Tour
fields.review: Really enjoyed the tour of Los Angeles. Mike our tour guide was very knowledgeable, funny and patience. He made everybody feel comfortable. I particularly enjoyed the visit to Universal Studios. The experience as a whole was great especially being a first timer to Los Angeles. I definitely recommend this tour.

fields.title: Great Experience
fields.review: We spent 7 days in Los Angeles on this tour. We got to not only see and experience some of the city's biggest tourist places, but we also got great background information and history about the places we went. Our tour guide Raul was great. Would totally recommend.

fields.title: Great Trip
fields.review: We had a great time on this trip to of San Francisco. It has a good mix of guided activities and personal time to explore. The highlight was definitely watching the sea lions at Fisherman's Wharf. Sam was a great guide, he was very informative and entertaining. We loved the whole trip.

fields.title: Amazing Tour
fields.review: It‘s been a great 12 days on this tour of San Francisco. Even if you‘ve high expectations it will be great. Mike was a great tour guide. He gave us the history of the areas and was super informative. There was never a dull moment. I really enjoyed all the places but the highlight for me was visiting the Painted Ladies. Would totally recommend!

fields.title: Loved This Tour
fields.review: We went on this tour of Milan and we loved it. Everything was well thought out and organised. You stay at great hotels, see all the main sights of the city. Our tour guide was Marco, he was funny, attentive, thoughtful, and informative. I would definitely recommend going on this tour.

fields.title: Best Tour Ever
fields.review: This tour of Milan was honestly the best tour I’ve even experienced. Our tour guide was Marco, he knew so much about the city, especially lots of interesting trivia that is very niche and I would never find out otherwise. Would definitely recommend this tour.

fields.title: Great 1st Trip to Portugal
fields.review: This was the ideal location and hotel was excellent throughout. The Food, staff and pool were all excellent and the shops were only a 2 minute walk away. We caught a little train that went to new town and old town which cost 5 euros for a day rider and we also went to see the dolphins & caves on a yellow boat for 35 euros. Will be going back in the near future.

fields.title: Wonderful Holiday
fields.review: 5 star treatment from the moment we walked in the door. Extremely clean , lovely friendly staff and plenty of sun loungers and space round the pool. Very spacious apartments and a huge balcony. Entertainment every night and the food in the restaurant down stairs was excellent.

fields.title: A Break in the Sun
fields.review: The rooms were clean and tidy and were regularly serviced. The grounds were well maintained with plenty of sun beds and the staff were very helpful. The location was ideal for a quiet holiday with easy access to a beautiful beach. It was a 20 minute walk to Lagos which was easily done.

fields.title: Brilliant Hotel
fields.review: The staff really pushed the boat out to ensure we enjoyed ourselves. The hotel was spotlessly clean, food was wonderful and the pool together with bar and pizzeria were great. Lagos is a great place to enjoy the friendly, laid back Portuguese lifestyle and there are plenty of interesting towns and sights nearby to explore. Algarve beach's are out of this world. How sorry we were when our stay ended!

fields.title: Great Hotel
fields.review: Very clean hotel staff are very friendly. The hotel is in a great location of Praia Da Rocha. We have been to this hotel several times and never been disappointed. The breakfast are one of the best that we have experienced and cooked fresh to your liking. We will certainly be back to this hotel.

fields.title: Excellent Hotel
fields.review: The Room was spacious and the bed was very comfortable. Only had breakfast but food was good with plenty variety to choose from. Staff were very friendly. All areas of the hotel were spotlessly clean. In an excellent position for access to a fantastic beach and within walking distance to restaurants and bars.

fields.title: Lovely Hotel
fields.review: This hotel is spotless, staff are so friendly. Great location. It was only a 20 min walk to the beach, 10 min walk to bars and restaurants and a 5 min walk to the supermarket. The only problem was there were not enough sun beds around the pool. Would definitely go back!

fields.title: Enjoyable Stay in Alvor
fields.review: Extremely comfortable and modern accommodation with efficient, friendly staff from reception to cleaning. Breakfast choices were vast and the restaurant was pleasant with a good price structure. The grounds were lovely - a pleasurable place to stay.

fields.title: Our Favourite Hotel
fields.review: If you get a room with a sea view you will love sitting in your balcony and enjoying the beautiful sights and sounds of the ocean both day or night. The staff who work there are so friendly and helpful which makes such a difference to any holiday.

fields.title: Excellent Hotel
fields.review: This is our second trip to this hotel and we were not disappointed. The attention to detail is excellent and customer service outstanding. Nothing is too much trouble for anybody and they go to great lengths to ensure you are delighted with their service. The buffet is the best I have experienced, always fresh with loads of choice. We will definitely be returning.

fields.title: An Amazing Holiday
fields.review: This is a very good hotel in a great location. We had a superior room that had a wonderful view of the beach and a fully equipped kitchen. The breakfast was very good with something to suit all tastes. There is a lovely pool area with plenty sunbeds both round the pool and on a lawned area. All the staff we came into contact with did everything they could to make your visit a good experience.

fields.title: Great Hotel
fields.review: This hotel was excellent we had a superior room with a sea view and it was absolutely gorgeous. The room was spacious,clean and quiet. The service was very good also. The location was perfect with Praia Da Luz town centre just a 5 minute walk away. The food was very good with plenty to eat for all tastes. The staff were very helpful and polite.

fields.title: First Class Hotel and Staff.
fields.review: Cannot praise this hotel or its staff more highly. Such attention to detail. Excellent food and many choices. The management here are second to none and this shows in the staff. Ideal for families with young children. From the moment of booking, we had the very best holiday experience. Thank you.

fields.title: Lovely Stay
fields.review: Stayed in one of the refurbished villas with a sea view and they were fantastic. Food was great, plenty of choice for everybody throughout the day, no complaints at all, service throughout the complex was second to none, clean and tidy. A taxi into Fethiye was always available, no problems. Would definitely recommend for all ages.

fields.title: Outstanding Resort
fields.review: The most relaxing holiday you will have. The hotel staff are very friendly and the facilities are excellent. There is daily entertainment during the day and theatre in the evenings. The food is top quality with lots of choice even for a picky eater. You won't be disappointed.

fields.title: One of the Best Holidays
fields.review: We stayed for a week here and this hotel has everything you need. Rooms are perfect and there is a choice of food to cater for most tastes. As it's all inclusive there is food and drinks available all day. There is 2 pools one of which has a slide, and we didn't have trouble really getting a sun lounger. The beach is directly across the road with plenty sun beds. Highly recommend this hotel.

fields.title: Brilliant
fields.review: Just had a week at this hotel with friends and it was brilliant. I fact we liked it so much we have booked another trip next year. Staff were very helpful and friendly. The food was excellent. The room were clean and spacious. It’s location is ideal for exploring the shops bars and the beach.

fields.title: Great Stay
fields.review: We had the best holiday the staff were amazing, the hotel was spotless it was more than we could have wished for. We will definitely be going back perfect all round. The resort was quite but the entertainment was there if you wanted to join in, we walked into the local village which was beautiful. Would definitely recommend.

fields.title: Great apartments
fields.review: The apartments were great really spacious clean and tidy. Our apartment was by the pool which was well kept and on-site bar was great with background music playing at a very pleasurable level. The cleaning staff were great and nothing was too much trouble.

fields.title: Excellent Location
fields.review: Lovely apartment with everything you need on a holiday. Pool area was very clean with plenty of sun beds. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Very quiet on a night not noisy. Situated just just 200 metres away from the main promenade, with plenty of bars and restaurants. Very good value for money.

fields.title: Wonderful Hotel
fields.review: This is a wonderful hotel with really lovely and helpful staff. The hotel is spotless. I have never stayed in a hotel that has had such a clean pool! The food was good quality with a good choice. Ideal for a short break and even though near to bars and restaurants was quiet. Looking forward to returning soon.

fields.title: Great Holiday
fields.review: The hotel is situated just a short walk away from the centre of Marbella. Excellent facilities both in the room and the hotel. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast and evening meal buffets were plentiful with good fresh food. I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

fields.title: Incredible Stay
fields.review: I just came back from my stay at this resort and I really have to say it was such a dream vacation. This trip has exceeded all my expectations. My room was absolutely beautiful, very spacious, tidy, modern and super private. The food, the staff, the rooms and just everything was a dream. I'm sure I will be back again!

fields.title: Best Hotel Stay
fields.review: Everything about this hotel exceeded my expectations. Every member of staff I had an encounter with was amazing and the breakfast tasted amazing and had loads of options. Everything about the hotel was perfect. The emerald suite with the private pool and a sea view was the most beautiful thing to wake up to. We even got to meet and speak with the owner. He was so lovely and recommended a lot for us to do in the area. I can’t wait to be back next year.

fields.title: Relaxing Break
fields.review: This was a relaxing break in a very pleasant, quiet hotel. Every member of staff was wonderfully helpful and friendly, they couldn't do enough for us. Very clean place and I recommend it highly. The food in the restaurant was good and reasonably priced. Very nice pool.

fields.title: Lovely Place
fields.review: We booked our holiday on the strength of the reviews for this place, we were not disappointed. The rooms are better than average and the complex is nice but what made our holiday was the staff, nothing was too much trouble. Would stay here again.

fields.title: Amazing Holiday
fields.review: Lambis Studios in Lindos is a amazing place to stay. Very clean, friendly staff and the food is great. The pool is very good with plenty of sun beds. The studios are spacious and very comfortable. If you prefer quite evenings don't ask for poolside view as it can be noisy. Studios are about 10 minutes walk into Lindos Town which is beautiful with plenty of roof top bars.

fields.title: Lovely Lindos
fields.review: Lovely, relaxing place to stay. Towels changed daily, gardens well cared for. We have never stayed by the pool before. It was lovely here and no sun bed races. Plenty available as not lots of guests only 6 blocks. Location to the town only 10 minutes away. Nearby Pefkos which is lovely 10 minute taxi ride or local bus. Lovely restaurants to visit in the evening and good beach. I will definitely be returning.

fields.title: Great Holiday
fields.review: Very cozy hotel in a convenient location close to the town. Super friendly staff, guys at the restaurant and the front desk were very helpful. The hotel is clean, modern and comfortable. The food here is pretty delicious. All in all we had a wonderful stay.

fields.title: Lovely Hotel
fields.review: Lovely boutique hotel very close to Mykonos town. Perfect for a relaxing stay. Nice and clean room, tasty breakfast and awesome pool. All the staff and the manager were amazing. So helpful and accommodating did their best to make us feel like home. Would highly recommend.

fields.title: Perfect Stay
fields.review: Just got back from our stay at this hotel, we loved every minute of it. Great pool area and exceptionally friendly staff more than willing to help you.The food was excellent with great breakfast selection and our room was immaculate. Definitely one of the best hotels we've ever stayed in.

fields.title: Amazing Hotel
fields.review: My friends and I had a fantastic week at this hotel, its quiet and has amazing pool side facilities. The restaurant and staff was amazing, the food in the restaurant was very nice and the staff very friendly and attentive. I would highly recommend this hotel for your next holiday.

fields.title: Great Stay
fields.review: We stayed for 13 nights at the Creta Palm. The rooms were spotless and cleaned every day, the food was delicious and varied. Beach 2 min walk from the hotel, shops very close as well. We rented a car and visited good few places araund the area. It is a good location if you want to go to Balos, Falasarna, Preveli, Elafonissi. We will definitely come back.

fields.title: Excellent Hotel
fields.review: The hospitality of the staff at Top Hotel were excellent. The property and grounds were very clean and well maintained. All the staff were helpful and went out of their way to make our stay wonderful. To top it all off the views are outstanding and I highly recommend this hotel.

fields.title: Lovely Place
fields.review: We had a fabulous 10 days at the Admiral. The location is excellent, the facilities were first rate and the staff were happy and attentive. The food was delicious and so much choice there is bound to be something you like. Wouldn't hesitate to go back.

fields.title: Brilliant Holiday
fields.review: Everything was great about this hotel and nothing was too much trouble for the staff. The rooms were cleaned every day, the pool area was kept clean and the breakfast was plentiful, one of the best continental breakfasts we have had. Lovely quiet location away from the nightlife but in easy reach of the resort. Would stay here again.

fields.title: Dream Holiday
fields.review: We spent 6 days at Litsa Apartments. I can say it was our dream vacation, nice staff, nice rooms with sea view, wonderful location up to the mountains. We could see from our balcony the entire landscape above the sea. The food was excellent and fresh. Very good quality for the price.

fields.title: Great Stay
fields.review: We have just returned from a two week stay here. We thought this was excellent value for money. It's quiet, scenic and clean. The service was excellent with warm, caring, and attentive staff. The food was delicious with a good variety to choose from, and we loved the views at sunrise/sunset. Highly recommend.
